title: Not Ready To Turn It Off Yet?
text:
This is such a taboo subject that I can't discuss it with anyone I know.

What does one do when there is a mis-match between physical desire and spousal availability? When the bridge is suddenly washed out and you can't get to the other side?

Our culture preaches monogamy, fidelity, hanging in there through thick and thin, "for better or for worse," etc. And then there is ridiculous drivel along the lines of "take a cold shower," "get a hobby," and "grow out of it."

So I throw out the question to women of a certain age and temperment. If you are in a stable marriage and have physical desires that are not being met, how do you deal with the condition you find yourself in? Do you bury yourself in your career, volunteer projects, or other distractions? Have you developed coping strategies that work over the long term? Or have you totally sublimated your desire for physical intimacy and taken the key out of the ignition?

I am willing to share details of my journey. You may remain totally anonymous.

title: Consciousness, conscience and compassion
text:
Some people think that the excitement wears off in a relationship over time... but when the excitement comes from a place of great depth and connection, a place of compassion and understanding, then that excitement doesn't have to disappear; rather, it matures into a love where you are excited just to be together and see each other, to share your feelings, thoughts and experiences. 

Maybe you can imagine being with someone in this way, where you don't have to argue about petty things, because both of you would go out of your way to understand the other person's wants and needs and to make the other person feel good about themselves. Maybe you can even feel, if you close your eyes, the sense of peace and calm when you wake up in the morning and reflect on that depth of love and connection you share with someone--an ocean-like calm that starts in your belly or chest and diffuses throughout your whole body, radiating out in the smile on your face. 

And this calm does not cancel out the excitement of being around this person; rather, it just clears out the ordinary anxieties of life and loneliness that get in the way of enjoying that passion with another person. And if you can imagine how that swirl of passion and joy floats happily in that ocean of calm, then you get where I'm coming from and what I'm looking for, too.

Now, I'm not for every woman. I'm a successful, professional, SWM who lives with two cats. I'm 420-friendly, but for me it's just about laughing and having fun, not dependency and escapism. I'm a strong believer in the healing power of plant medicines such as ayahuasca, but I'm also a strong believer in the healing power of meditation and compassion. I believe in those paths that enhance life, love and compassion, and I want to share that with the right woman.

I consider myself a spiritual person, but for me spirituality is not about prudishness and judgment. For me spirituality means being humble before the awe of the universe, being in touch with yourself, being centered and grounded, yet being open to the moment and the beauty of the world. Being spiritual is about being compassionate and connected, both to other people and to the universe. 

Now if you can see yourself connecting with what I have described here, and if you can feel--for your own reasons--that this is something you want, too, then we owe it to ourselves to meet and talk.

title: SWM for very tall, articulate and...different
text:
I happen to be off for the next two days, and would like to meet someone new. It's going to be really nice out, and you've got to strike while the iron is hot. Still, it's not like we actually have any control over when love comes into our lives, it just pops up when fate determines that it should. Whether we seize the day or not is up to us.

If the above paragraph didn't give it away, I'm a writer. Not by trade, yet, even though some of my work is out there and available to purchase. I want to use these two days to compose reams of new material, but everybody needs a break, every writer needs a muse, and let's face it--all work and no play...etc.

Sometimes the responses I get to ads like this make me feel like I'm giving the wrong impression of myself. Try as I might, I never seem to get it quite right. I do have a physical preference, but that doesn't mean that I have an exact mental image of the person I expect to meet. Nor does it mean that I don't care what your personality is like. One intro email I received recently was from someone who told me she's 5'9" and has a Master's degree--and nothing else. I should be up-front about this: A lot of people have Master's degrees. Some of them are blithering idiots. Some people who don't have them are geniuses. I want to know more substantial things about you, what makes you tick. Your beliefs and your reasons for those beliefs, your taste in movies, how you react to sarcasm, things like that. I want to know that if I ask you how you're doing, you won't just give me a one-word answer and then not ask me back. As you might have guessed, I get a lot of that as well. Lots of personality to go around in the online dating arena. :)

I'd prefer that you are between roughly 21 and 34, with no children and a belief in God. The rest is negotiable, though I will also put out there that I like women who are very tall...so if you're at least 5'10", cool, and don't be too self-conscious to respond if you're 6'7" or something. I'll be happy to talk to you. I'll also be happy to talk to you whether you're skinny, athletic, average or curvy, and proportions aren't an issue.

I feel like it's good to maintain a little bit of mystery about myself, but surely you want to know a little something. I've already said that I'm a writer. I'm also Catholic, Italian, a Trekkie, a foodie and a fan of all types of humor. I collect books, watches, music and old video games. I love to walk and I love to spend time on all sorts of creative pursuits. My temper is practically nonexistent, my shoulders are broad and my disposition is friendly but somewhat aloof. Also, I suck at writing personal ads!

That's one huge chunk of text up there. Hopefully I kept your attention and made you laugh a couple times. If I did, maybe I can do it again, but in person over coffee. You tell me.

title: CUDDLE BUDDY
text:
Ever wish you had someone to cuddle with? Someone to just hang out with? You know, like those days where you are like, "well shit, if I were in a relationship they could just come over, snuggle, watch tv, etc. etc." 

Yeah, that would be nice. Perhaps just stay in bed all day on a Sunday and write it off as a lazy day while we order delivery food and watch TV in bed all day. Rub my back to make me fall asleep and reach for me in the midnight hours. Have someone to wake up to and fix you breakfast before they head off to work. Yep! I'm THAT guy. 

As for me: I'm above average height 6'3", black hair and warm expressive brown eyes, a great smile and above average in attractiveness. 

Not looking for drama as I'm direct and straightforward so I'd appreciate someone similar. 
Someone to share in passionate conversations where we are both challenged, laugh, flirt and ultimately devour each other as we are caught up in the passion of the moment. Call it whatever -- a part-time boyfriend, friends w/ benefits, emotional affair or simply a spring fling.

Like the title says I am looking for true love and my soul mate. Tired of meeting trying the wrong pseudo people out there so if you are not authentic then keep it moving don't read any further. If you are real then take a chance on me you won't be disappointed. I have a lot to offer the right person (my soul mate) as I well established, authentic, and a true gentleman. I am a candor, honest, authentic, and naturally kind person in life. I am looking for the same or similar in a female partner in this life. I am single by choice b/c I don't like or tolerate drama. I have never had any kids (none that I know of)....lol I am a clean person who does not sleep around as I am very selective who I copulate with. I am in good shape and very attractive to the eyes so I am told. I am 5' 9" with a slim build but strong for my size as I workout when I can. I love outdoors, nature, any body of water, and just talking and taking in the simple things in life. I used to do a lot of sports like play baseball, track, running, and others. I still run to stay in shape/active when I make time for it. I am a rarity in the fact that I am naturally kind would literally give you the shirt off my back if I found you needed it while laying on the ground. That is a quality that is not taught either you would do that or you would keep walking or at least that is what I am learned in that matter in this life. I have good job, excellent credit, and am well off with money. So I am not here for someone to pay for me or to pay for someone I am here for that special someone in life. If we match up then we could have a endless love together.

After all in life and Love you need to take a great deal of risk to get to your soul mate. So If you are uncomfortable with taking risks like reciprocating back full view current pictures and exchanging emails then DON'T BOTHER TO RESPOND TO ME AT ALL. 
Age and Race Don't matter 2 Love & Ditto for myself.....
So I know you are real and not some bot or spam put Ocean in the subject line when you respond. Be willing to send several full view current pictures of yourself like you see of me here which is only fair. Also be willing to exchange/give your email so we can communicate directly instead of using the masked/hidden email that CL makes you use. With all that being stated/said I know my true love is out there somewhere for me. I look forward to hearing from whoever you may be... Come What May....

title: Looking for a Plump, Thick, Curvy or BBW ASIAN Gal
text:
Looking for an ASIAN gal for dating or friendship who is solid and has has some meat on her bones. Someone who is not fat, but not skinny or bony either. Pleasantly plump, thick, solid, strong or CURVY with large b@@bs is a plus : )

I am a d/d free handsome professional mature white male. Additional profile "stats" or details have been put into the ad already.

If this piques your interest, then drop me a line and tell me where you're located and something about yourself. A photo with your reply would be great; I will gladly send you mine in return.

XXOO

title: Looking for a REDHEAD
text:
**** NO MEN!

Hi!

I am a mature, SWM , 5'9 with dark brown hair and hazel eyes. I have a masters degree. I am well traveled and have a professional job. 

I live in NoVa and work in DC.

In my free time I enjoy exercising, playing tennis, dining out, watching movies, exploring DC, having intelligent conversations, going on day trips and traveling.

I am easy going, funny, loyal, caring. I love to laugh and make a woman laugh!

I am attracted to redheads. If you are a redhead, I would love to hear from you! :)

title: SBM Looking for Substance
text:
Looking to begin as friends and see where it goes. Marriage and kids is something I have yet to experience, but would love to experience it with the right person when the time is right. My ideal relationship would be the kind of relationship just us in regards to not having to worry about another woman or another man coming in between us. I would like the kind of relationship where social media has ZERO impact on our relationship. 

I work full time. I have a Bachelors degree. I have my own place. I own a car. I don't smoke or do drugs. I do enjoy a drink every now and then but responsibly. If you asked me to describe my personality with a few words, those words would be unselfish, caring, helpful, family oriented, funny, sweet, loyal, honest, patient and low tolerance for drama, BS and games. 

My mother taught me how to treat a lady and to be a gentleman. She taught me how to cook (I'm alright, I ain't no top of the line chef) and do the laundry. My dad taught me how to be a man. He taught me how to handle business and hold it down. He taught me that a man works to provide. Together my parents have taught me love, respect, and manners. I'm an old school kind of guy. I still believe in saying thank you, please, excuse me. My parents have been happily married for nearly 40 years so I like to think that I've had one of the best examples in the world on what it takes take to make a relationship work. 

I'm not going to say that you must be all of the following because that will make you perfect in my eyes and nobody is perfect. So I would say I'd rather you possess some of the following. Being unselfish, honest, loyal, understanding, sense of humor, can hold conversation. Someone employed, someone who drives, and has her own place or some combination of the 3. Has confidence in herself. A woman who is a lady in the streets and freak in the bed. Your shape and size does not matter to me. Your brains and a sense of humor is what will catch my attention. If you're an awesome person then you got me. You can have the phattest ass, the biggest tits and the wettest stuff between your legs but I'm posting in the LTR section. I want your mind and personality to drive me just as wild

I also have a very sexual side to me. I'm the kind of guy who can't keep his hands off his woman. Not saying that I'll be all over you 24/7 but I do like to cop a feel every now and then lol. I'm that guy that will have that "damn she looking so sexy to me right now" moments and come up behind you while you're washing dishes or cooking or whatever and do, *ahem*, naughty things. I like to think of myself as an affectionate guy. You can probably get me to turn the game off if you really persuade me. 

Please know that I am serious. Was this just enough to get you interested? Looking fwd to hearing from you. Would you kindly do me a favor and put in the subject box your location or zip code? Help me ignore the bots.

title: Honest, Open-Minded, and Nice Guy
text:
Hello!

Let me begin by acknowledging that I know there are a ton of guys that post on CL, but I am going to try this nonetheless. 

I should probably let you know that I have never been arrested and I'm not a creep. I have a great job that requires extensive background checks - so rest assured.

So, I'm a good guy. My friends would describe me as honest, intelligent, open-minded, and genuine. I've been very blessed in my life for a number of reasons and try my best to pass that blessing on to others.

I moved to the Arlington/McLean area recently and pretty much don't know a soul, which is why you are finding me writing an ad on CL - what is there to lose?


I'm posting today because I'd like to find a woman that is awesome. I am not looking for drama, just a great person who can be a confidant/lover/friend. I'd prefer to meet an intelligent, honest, open-minded, mature woman. A college degree and career would be nice, plus no children.

Why did I title my ad "Honest, Open-Minded, and Nice Guy?" Because I think those three words best describe me. I've lived an eventful life and it'd be great to find someone who can handle that :)

I am one-hundred percent single and no drama in my life. I promise.

Yes, I have pictures, but I think it'd be better to trade through email.

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: SUNDAY MASSAGE FOR YOU (NOT LOOKING FOR PAYMENT)
text:
I'm looking to give someone a massage today. I love giving them. I'm not a pro and I don't have a table so we'll have to make it work. I'm a tall, white male with an average build. Single and have my own place. I'd like to do this today or tonight.

Pic for pic. Not looking for sex.

title: Dinner drinks movie
text: Anyone interested in hanging out today or later this week? We could get out for a drinks and dinner and then catch a movie. This is my treat. I'd love to hear back from you if your interested. Also, please be between 33 and 45and don't be skinny.

title: Geek Guy Seeks Geek Gal
text:
Looking for someone down to earth to geek out with and have a LTR. Should be in her late 30's to 40's so we get each other's references. I am a well rounded guy who is a closet geek. Would love to find a girlfriend who can share this side of me. Can't say I've ever had that. It's been mostly tolerated in the past. But it would be amazing to actually be with someone who enjoys sci-fi and fantasy. Who will binge watch the Walking Dead with me or go see a Star Wars or Star Trek movie with me. On top of that, I want someone I can share my life with.

I also like to paint landscapes in the park and read a good book. I love live music and going to different museums. I can fix most anything and have been told my super power would be the ability to fix most things. I enjoy computers and electronics and read a lot about new tech. I am a romantic and love to figure out ways to show the woman of my life how much she means to me everyday. I'm affectionate and caring. Honest to a fault, monogamist and dependable. Your pic gets mine. Please reply with Geeky Gal in the heading so the robot apocalypse doesn't get me. Zombie apocalypse, that's another story.

~Rich~

title: DWM Seeks Cool Funny Smart Creative Artsy DC Foodie
text:
Yes. I know. Looking for the proverbial Perfect Woman in the Washington DC Haystack. I live in NNJ but love getting to the DC area every chance I can. (I was born and grew up in the area) And, what says the Universe is going to conveniently put the perfect woman for me in my zip code??!!?? 

Myself? 55... 6'4"...HWP....Tattooed...Spent 30 years as a stand-up comedian/writer. Now, still write and perform when I can. I also do voice work on radio stations all over the country..... For a paycheck, General Manager of the #1 Mexican restaurant in Morris County, NJ. Major passions: Food (obviously) all types, music, art, theater & film. Voracious reader. Love to dance. And, am actually pretty good at it for being a 55 year old white guy from the suburbs. As for sports? Sorry. I don't know a first down from first base. But, have no trouble enjoying any sort of game with a gal who does. As for being a good kisser? The top of your head may come off and streamers may shoot out. : )

Have no particular physical "type". Brains and personality and an honest heart are pretty much my priorities. And, to be perfectly honest? Where else but around the DC area are there amazingly cool intelligent women into great food, great music, the arts and romance who can't find the right man? Nothing keeping me in NJ but my job, which I can do anywhere. If I meet the right woman and we "click"? I'd relocate for her.

Thanks for your time and if I don't spark anything in you. I hope you find someone that does.

title: Do you still get wet?
text:
That's good, I got your attention and you are reading me now! Checking to see if I can punch my way out of the paper bag I put myself in.

I am NOT looking for a sex-crazed woman. Well, I dunno, maybe I am! The reason I headlined so outrageously is I know I do NOT want to find a woman for whom sex is a small part of the relationship but not a big part. I am still vigorous enough to know that sex is a very important part of the relationship I want. And like Freud, for me sex is any kind of touching; if you do not like being touched by your man, you have the wrong fella.

I am very smart and well-educated and well-read. I say this not to scare you off or to compete with you but to give you information. If these are things you find attractive, then please read on. If you call smart and informed people pseudo-intellectuals, please pass me by.

I am non-religious -- or more correctly non-theological; if you are ultra-orthodox or fundamentalist, you will not like me.

My politics are Left-Wing. Conservatives would call me Socialist even though I am not. I am very political. Again, this is just for information sake. If you are Conservative, I am not, just letting you know.

I am over 60, a very young over 60. I am 5 feet 9 inches tall and I weigh 155 lbs. Average build. Caucasian, New York Jewish blood. Blue eyes, glasses, gray hair (NOT bald), distinguished looking, good-looking. Semi-retired.

What am I looking for? You should be over 5 feet. Any age. Any race or nationality. You should not be a BBW (no, you need not be your high school weight either) and you should be "close" to your ideal weight (a "BMI" between 19 and 22). You should like to smile and laugh. You should be worldly (not stuck in your hometown all your life and OK with that) and want to travel.

You should be feminine (you would appreciate a Victoria's Secret gift, and not give me a dirty look, and you have a shape that would invite a Victoria's Secret gift!). Part tomboy is OK too. I own no TV and I do not waste time watching pro sports on the weekend. I DO love movies (when I am alone, anyway).

I used that headline because women who are age appropriate for me sometimes think that they are done with sex or are happy to be done with sex. Whether from being post-menopausal or from a less than wonderful sexual life. They are not for me.

I will not send you a photo. You can understand this based on my ad's candor. I would like a photo from you or failing that at least a good self-description. I do NOT want to conduct a long interview by email; if you mail me, I will want to meet you soon and you should too. Give me enough information to want to meet YOU.

Looking forward, etc...

title: Looking for tall, sweet and different
text:
I happen to be off today, and would like to meet someone new. It's freezing out, so even though it might be a bit crazy, you've got to strike while the iron is hot. Ironic metaphor, I know. Still, it's not like we actually have any control over when love comes into our lives, it just pops up when fate determines that it should. Whether we seize the day or not is up to us.

If the above paragraph didn't give it away, I'm a writer. Not by trade, yet, even though some of my work is out there and available to purchase. I want to use today to compose reams of new material, but everybody needs a break, every writer needs a muse, and let's face it--all work and no play...etc.

Sometimes the responses I get to ads like this make me feel like I'm giving the wrong impression of myself. Try as I might, I never seem to get it quite right. I do have a physical preference, but that doesn't mean that I have an exact mental image of the person I expect to meet. Nor does it mean that I don't care what your personality is like. One intro email I received recently was from someone who told me she's 5'9" and has a Master's degree--and nothing else. I should be up-front about this: A lot of people have Master's degrees. Some of them are blithering idiots. Some people who don't have them are geniuses. I want to know more substantial things about you, what makes you tick. Your beliefs and your reasons for those beliefs, your taste in movies, how you react to sarcasm, things like that. I want to know that if I ask you how you're doing, you won't just give me a one-word answer and then not ask me back. As you might have guessed, I get a lot of that as well. Lots of personality to go around in the online dating arena. :)

I'd prefer that you are between roughly 21 and 34, with no children and a belief in God. The rest is negotiable, though I will also put out there that I like women who are very tall...so if you're at least 5'10", cool, and don't be too self-conscious to respond if you're 6'7" or something. I'll be happy to talk to you. I'll also be happy to talk to you whether you're skinny, athletic, average or curvy, and proportions aren't an issue.

I feel like it's good to maintain a little bit of mystery about myself, but surely you want to know a little something. I've already said that I'm a writer. I'm also Catholic, Italian, a Trekkie, a foodie and a fan of all types of humor. I collect books, watches, music and old video games. I love to walk and I love to spend time on all sorts of creative pursuits. My temper is practically nonexistent, my shoulders are broad and my disposition is friendly but somewhat aloof. Also, I suck at writing personal ads!

That's one huge chunk of text up there. Hopefully I kept your attention and made you laugh a couple times. If I did, maybe I can do it again, but in person over coffee. You tell me.

title: If you think you're too tall to find an incredible match...you're not.
text:
If you clicked the link, either you're just tall or you feel like your height is preventing you from meeting quality men. I don't know why more men don't share my preference, though some women have told me that they actually do, and that these men hit on them all the time. I don't know the truth. All I know is that I'm looking for someone who's at least 5'10"--though if you're 6'5" or even taller, don't be shy! Wear your heels, even. Don't worry about that first step. Take it, and I'll take your hand.

Obviously, personality and the contents of the soul are far more important than height/physicality, but this is Craigslist--I might as well ask for all my preferences. So let's talk about the non-physical.
I'm not all about this latest iteration of feminism. I'm all for equality, but I don't like apologizing for having male parts, or threatening women by saying things like "Hello". It would be great to meet someone who can speak her mind and tell me what she wants without trying to castrate me. I'd like to meet a woman who's considerate, kind and easy to talk to. Someone who laughs easily. In return, I pledge to open every door and spoil you as much as I can! It would also be nice if you believe in God, or at least have respect for people who do. As far as age is concerned, let's go with 21-34.
Deal-breakers. They're evil, but they exist. Here they are:

1.	Weight is just a number--I know. It's how it's carried that matters to me, and only because I have a difficult time being close to someone who's past a certain point. Up to that point, it makes no difference, honestly. If you look like Marilyn Monroe, fine; Rosie O'Donnell--well, I can't. But I wish you luck.

2.	Kids. I'd like to have my own biological children someday. That would be complicated if you have children already.

3.	It would be difficult for me to have this kind of relationship with a die-hard atheist or Muslim. If you fall into either category, I wish you the best--but we would have fundamental disagreements.

Now that I've talked all about what I want, I should probably say a bit about myself--though I'll leave some mystery. It's easiest to get to know someone through conversation, after all.

I'm an author with a day job. It's a good job to have in the current economy, but it's not one I intend to stick with forever. I've been looking for other opportunities, continuing to write and promoting my work like crazy. In my free time I like to walk (in decent weather, anyway), collect music (digitally, for my mp3 player), relax with friends (usually playing Cards Against Humanity or something equally conducive to conversation and hilarity), play classic video games (in moderation) and sleep (obligatory parentheses). I was raised Catholic but haven't been to mass in ages. I don't lose my temper and I laugh all the time. I can bounce between banter and philosophy at the drop of a hat.
You want to know more, right?

A lil about me: I am over 50, reasonably fit, handsome, don't drink, smoke cigarettes, do drugs, intelligent, well traveled and educated. Own a home, cars and business.
Now, to anyone who replies...I am trying to date you, tell me something about you and why you think you would be a good fit for me. Tell me where you are, send a decent picture and NOT just a face shot I want to know what YOU look like, so one of your body too. Do not ask me to call or text or go to some other e-address to contact you...NOT until you communicate first right here. 
Lastly if your not willing to talk on a phone after we make contact...don't bother.
Here's a starter pic, I'll send more when I get a serious response..put, let's be open in the subject line.

title: Anyone else crave an affair?
text:
The possibility of this working is slim to none but nothing ventured nothing gained.

The thought of having a secret relationship with a women, who on the outside lives a wholesome cookie cutter life but behind closed doors she shares my secret excites me. That we are lovers, that when time allows we meet even just to see each other and share a kiss, we email each other to stay in touch and when time and space allows, you let me have you. 

Unlike 90% of CL posters, I don't have a laundry list of requirements that you have to meet. I'm pretty open to age, and race. You can be married or single I'm fine with that just understand that I'm married and if you are to understand that I'm not looking to add drama or change your situation and in return you do the same.

I'm a 35 year old married male living in Sterling. Normal and down to earth. I'm 5'8 with black hair, brown eyes, 180 lbs, short hair, and medium build, my folks are from India. It's a generic description but haven't sent any babies crying yet. 

Please put your age and location in the subject line.

Note: If you want/require or ask for a pic in the first 5 emails don't bother responding not because I'm hideous or trying to mask a physical flaw but BECAUSE it's CL. I'm married and don't need my picture floating around.

THIS IS NOT AN AD FOR FINANCIAL COMPENSATION!

title: Can I watch you do yoga in your undies?
text: Cos you probably look beautiful, no matter what shape you're in. I'm a gentle older guy (American but mixed German and South Indian) with this on my bucket list. I'm also in dire need of learning yoga but clearly that's not what is driving this request :) It's just to sit and watch and appreciate you. Happy to barter something beautiful...I can sing you a song, teach you a few chords, we can draw together, go for a motorcycle ride or country drive, play a board game, have a picnic on the roof of a parking structure. Is that a relationship? No. But it's not nothing. And these days that's something.

title: Age & Race Don't matter to love & ditto for me..... So here I am now l
text:
So here I am now looking for my soul mate. Someone to share the joys and passions of life with. No matter where I go there I am. It always come back to me and I am now starting to want/desire a female to share the beautiful things in this short life with. I know you are out there and when/if you do read this please contact me. I know there is someone for all of us out there a match/soul mate. So here I go speaking straight from my heart to you in hopes to find my soul mate. I have tried this before on here and I have gotten a few HATERS ON HERE. To you I say this I don't make/write these for you so KEEP IT MOVING and leave me alone. The more emails/responses I get from you haters the more it shows how callous, simple minded, and that you are under my control. If you don't like me keep it moving I have done nothing to you and YOU DON'T EVEN KNOW ME..... So please stop emailing/harassing me STOP IT. Release yourself from your misery, pitiful sorrow, and your mean nature. I will keep trying until I find what I am looking for. Remember these Messages/Ads from my heart are not for you. They are for the one I have not met yet my soul mate. I wish no harm or bad on anyone on here not even the haters for they are controlled by their anger, meanness, lack of good judgment. So to All (even haters) good luck I hope you get laid or find whatever it is your are looking for in your life. So if you are that special person out there for me I look forward to hearing from you. You will find a unique, candor, authentic, and kind person who has a lot to offer the right person in this life. I don't need your money I have plenty, I don't need job I have good one, I only wish to meet someone who is drama free. Someone who does not lie to gain attention. Someone who is not afraid to stand on their own 2 feet and make decisions on their own. Someone who is a leader not a follower. Someone not afraid to take my hand and see where this world takes us. If you are that person look forward to hearing from you! Please don't respond back to me if you can't be fair enough to send back full view current pictures of you like the ones you already see of me here which is only fair.....

With all the fast pace things I still make time to see and do what I like which is stop and enjoy the beauty of nature. I took some beautiful pictures of the recent ice storm early in the am and I am remember seeing 1 other person doing the same thing that morning. We need more of that.... PASSION.... So here I am now looking for my soul mate. Someone to share the joys and passions of life with. No matter where I go there I am. It always come back to me and I am now starting to want/desire a female to share the beautiful things in this short life with. I know you are out there and when/if you do read this please contact me. I know there is someone for all of us out there a match/soul mate. So here I go speaking straight from my heart to you in hopes to find my soul mate. I have tried this before on here and I have gotten a few HATERS ON HERE. To you I say this I don't make/write these for you so KEEP IT MOVING and leave me alone. If you don't like me keep it moving I have done nothing to you and YOU DON'T EVEN KNOW ME..... So please stop emailing/harassing me STOP IT. Release yourself from your misery, pitiful sorrow, and your mean nature. I will keep trying until I find what I am looking for. Remember these Messages/Ads from my heart are not for you. They are for the one I have not met yet my soul mate. I wish no harm or bad on anyone on here not even the haters for they are controlled by their anger, meanness, lack of good judgment. I am a candor, honest, authentic, and naturally kind person in life. I am looking for the same or similar in a female partner in this life. I am single by choice b/c I don't like or tolerate drama. I have never had any kids (none that I know of)....lol I am a clean person who does not sleep around as I am very selective who I copulate with. I am in good shape and very attractive to the eyes so I am told. I am 5' 9" with a slim build but strong for my size as I workout when I can. I love outdoors, nature, any body of water, and just talking and taking in the simple things in life. I used to do a lot of sports like play baseball, track, running, and others. I still run to stay in shape/active when I make time for it. I am a rarity in the fact that I am naturally kind would literally give you the shirt off my back if I found you needed it while laying on the ground. That is a quality that is not taught either you would do that or you would keep walking or at least that is what I am learned in that matter in this life. I have good job, excellent credit, and am well off with money. So I am not here for someone to pay for me or to pay for someone I am here for that special someone in life. title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. ease be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. If you would like to Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. If you would like to Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

title: Set, single, and stable. Just trying to find a sweet girl...
text:
For a place that's so diverse, I feel this place is still very segregated. I thought I'd turn here just to see what I would be able to find with an open mind, and once I state that I'm "Asian", I haven't gotten any responses outside of anyone who is not Asian. I understand that it's important to relate to the person, and I guess most non-Asian's would feel they wouldn't relate to an Asian. However, I was born here, and I have a very diverse set of friends and the type to get along to anyone. I'm also not Chinese, Vietnamese, Korean, the more common Asians that you meet here, in fact, you probably haven't met anyone from the country of my ethnicity before, but I'll let you figure out where that is later on.

I'm in my late-20s, have my own house, a stable career that pays well, but most importantly, I have a good head on my shoulders, and I like to make others laugh. I'm a caring guy, funny, outgoing, confident, and know how to make a girl feel special. I have no kids. Many girls I've met who are in relationships have always told me they are surprised how I am single. 

I have friends of all types, and it's not that I don't like Asians either, but would definitely like to see some more diversity in responses. I love all cultures and love going to cultural events in DC. As far as my interests, I love traveling, and would like to travel more often, especially with someone who loves to explore the world and try new things. I love good food, and I am on yelp all the time (I also contribute, I'm a yelp elite!) I'm also big on nutrition and eating right. One thing I'd like get more into is wine, but I have been acquiring the taste recently. I'm also into EDM, love Alesso and Calvin Harris. I'm also into outdoorsy activities like hiking/biking/kayaking, and love exploring cities. I'm considered pleasant to be around and fun-loving, love to make others laugh. I workout regularly, and have a medium/athletic build, I'm not skinny! I am also an art collector and would like to go to more art galleries/exhibits. The picture attached is from one of my favorite artists.

If you are looking for a guy who is mature, and ready to find his queen, then send an e-mail about yourself with a picture. Looking for a someone who is reasonably fit (BBWs are not my preference), in their 20s, and is pleasant positive person. In the subject line, feel free to tell me where you are from or your ethnicity. Why not take your chances on something that might ultimately be the best decision you have ever made?

title: looking to make a nice sweet full/part Asian girl happy :)
text:
After perusing the M4W ads just to see what you Asian females have to deal with, I came away laughing and sympathizing. There was one post in particular that said "I have the fever, Yellow fever. I admit, I've been having yellow fever for several months now.
Looking to date a beautiful Asian girl, go out, have fun, and get to know each other." That just made me laugh.

After having said that, I am an Asian guy who was born in the U.S., but grew up with Asian family values but had a very diverse set of friends (of all types) so I'm Americanized, but have Asian values instilled in me. I honestly have not dated Asian girls before, but my sister who got married in her late 30s, only dated white guys until the first Asian guy she really dated, and ended up marrying him soon after and said she's never been happier. We all thought she would settle down with a white guy since that's all she dated, which she thought so herself, but then she said after she dated the first Asian-American, there was just something about it that felt right and had a real connection that she never had before, and actually got married pretty soon after (a few months).

Anyways so that is what brings me here. After thinking about this, she makes several points. Asian values are pretty different than American values, no one has the "right values" but I definitely prefer Asian values and see the advantages. Asians age much better than other races, and we stay looking young. I see a lot of instances where white guys start to bald already in their mid-20s, I'm like seriously, already? one of my friends married this college guy (who is white) (she is like 4 years older), and now he's 25 and she's 28, he already looks he's like 40 (he has a huge bald spot and it's growing). Asians also take their food seriously, and I'm no exception. I very enthusiastic about good food hah, and most Asians are. You will see them in big groups at the restaurants with good chefs, not at some Applebees, Chilis, or T.G.I. Fridays. You'll see them in an Izakaya, Spicy Thai place, late night Korean BBQ, Pho noodle soup place. I definitely prefer Asian food over American, it's just so much more flavorful and interesting to me. I'm also an avid yelper so I know all the good places around here. Not only do I like to eat out at restaurants but I like to cook some too, and definitely would like someone to cook with. Asians are also very dedicated in their relationships, they generally aren't the schmoozer "get around" types, and divorce rates are the least amongst Asian couples.

title: 50 Shades of Trendy?
text:
This movie looks ridiculous! Right?!
So I've noticed that in the last month or so there's been a huge upsurge in women looking for dominant men, and interest in experimenting with BDSM to varying degrees. I kind of find this sociologically fascinating. I've been fond of kink for the last 10 years. I'm dominant and have been in relationships both vanilla and kinky (all depending on the limits of myself and whoever I'm with at the time, and the degree of interest in such activities she may have). Then in walks this best selling book series, and what seemed to be a more or less underground lifestyle is the talk of the town ( or maybe just Internet!) Now I haven't read the series myself, and I'm not coming from an overly judgemental place, but I am curious about it. I heard a story that it was started as Twilight fanfiction and eventually changed into this series of books. From what I know, the subtle hints of bondage in Twilight border more on misogyny than the kinky, intellectual power plays I'm used to, so I don't know how I feel about that... Plus I've always thought of BDSM as more of a counterculture lifestyle, and when those things get mainstream they always get bastardized and watered down.... If you think Blink182 is a real punk band, you may not get what I'm saying. Now I'm sure a similar upsurge like this happened when The Secretary ( and the short story that preceded it) came out... But I quite liked that and thought it was very well done ( more art house than pulp fiction). 
Anyway I guess I'm just calling out to see what you all think. Feel free to email me and chat, as I'm doing laundry and watching Netflix so I'd be down to learn something new, or just talk to new people... Whether you agree with my rather uninformed opinion or not.
Oh yeah, and I'm single, and professional, and educated, and a really nice, progressive cool dude, and all that stuff. 
Let's kill an evening chatting.

title: College instructor seeks young literature or art enthusiast
text:
You're sitting on a bench in the East Garden Court of the National Gallery of Art, quietly reading your book; and the sunlight filtering down through the skylight almost makes you feel like you are sitting on a blanket in a park on a beautiful morning.

You are a quiet, studious woman, and you choose your friends carefully. For that reason, you often prefer to spend time alone rather than with your fellow classmates. You consider many of the women in your classes to be flighty, disingenuous, or just plain annoying; and the men seem to be perpetually stuck in middle school with their crude humor and an almost total lack of outwardly-visible signs of intelligence. The few times you've ventured to make a witty comment about your favorite author or artist they've invariably looked at you with a blank stare as if you were speaking a different language. Perhaps you were, come to think of it...

But back to the atrium. You look up from your book and glance around. This is one of your favorite spots in the city, and at this time of the morning it is nearly empty. Occasionally a few people pass through on their way from one part of the museum to another, but right now the only other person you can see is an attractive, middle-aged man who is sitting diagonally across from you. He too is reading a book. This simple observation catches your attention.

For a moment you fix your eyes on the man. He looks to be about twice your age and, admittedly, he is quite handsome in a casual, college-professor sort of way. He has black, thick-framed glasses and is dressed attractively but comfortably in jeans, a plaid shirt, a brown blazer, and brown leather shoes. He has short, thick, brown hair with just a hint of grey at the temples, and he wears a simple gold band on his finger which, curiously, seems to make him even more alluring.

Briefly your mind wanders to thoughts of what it might be like to be alone with him. Perhaps you could talk to him and he would really listen. He might even be able to discuss topics other than sports and the latest TV shows. You wonder what it would feel like if he were to hold you. He looks tall and lean. He could probably pick you up with almost no effort at all, and if he is as healthy as he looks, he probably has great stamina in the heat of the. . . but you're getting ahead of yourself. He's just another guy in the museum, right?

Except that in the trance of your reverie, you have failed to notice that he has looked up and is now looking directly at you, his blue-grey eyes assessing you and penetrating you in a way that is not entirely platonic. Flustered, you look away. He's old enough to be your father. And yet, there was something exciting about the way he was looking at you that makes you want to look again. You close your book and reopen it and try to read a few lines and close it again. You came here to read in a quiet, peaceful setting, but now you can't concentrate. Damn him. Is he still looking? Quickly you raise your eyes and yes he is still looking and once again you look away.

How does the story continue? Perhaps he approaches you and breaks the ice by commenting on your pretty dress and asking you what you are reading? Or maybe you jot down your email address on a napkin and demurely hand it to him with a smile as you walk past him on your way out? Or possibly nothing happens at all, and you find yourself browsing the missed connections on Craigslist later that day, hoping to see something that might be meant for you.

Perhaps you should hit "reply" and see what really happens...

text:
I hear every now and then someone gets lucky (no pun intended) and finds what they are looking for on here. So I figured, why not give it a try, whats the worse that can happen? I'm not one to be out here sticking any and everything moving....too much stuff out here, I am disease free and want to stay that way. I am truly looking for someone I can have the best of both worlds with; a friend that I can go out with, movies, dinner, happy hour, play or concert with and when the mood hits us we can have the intimate piece as well. I love good sex, I love passion, and I love pleasing my partner.

Now, you may be saying to yourself, that sounds an awful lot like a relationship to me.....why don't he just go and get in a relationship. Truth be told, been there and tried that, however what I have noticed is that relationships bring on a lot of unnecessary stress, heartache and drama as expectations are created and when one party does not live up to the others expectations, problems begin. So I say, lets just wing it, keep it real with each other and have fun. Life is too short, lets enjoy it while we are here. I work hard so I like to play hard.....should you decide to respond, please be prepared to have some fun.

Quick description of myself, I'm 38 years old, 6'3 and 250lbs, built like a football player but moreso a big teddy bear that can turn grizzly when crossed. I'm college educated and a professional. Hobbies include almost anything to keep from being bored. Also, I am a nice looking brother if I do say so myself....I have pics to prove and am willing to share. title: The beautiful dichotomy - attractive intellectual seeks submissive
text:
First and foremost - I am a firm believer in communication. Whether in-person or online - our intentions, words, and actions are how we establish rapport, convey our desires, and ultimately define who we are as individuals. Our ability to empathize and relate is inherently bound to our capacity to effectively communicate our own expectations and discover/recognize our own internal motivators.

That to say - should you wish to contact me - please aim to reciprocate a level of communication in accordance with the consideration/effort I put into my own. :]

That aside; I am, ultimately, searching for a certain someone to address a void that has been present in my life for some time now. While I'm admittedly still discovering and uncovering aspects of my own sexuality and self - I definitely have come to understand, appreciate, and cherish various sexual 'power dynamics' and how they are capable of greatly enhancing connections and experiences. These 'enhancements' manifest themselves in many ways; lowered inhibitions, deeper notions of trust, increased passion and an overall "primal" ambiance - amongst the many other benefits.

I believe in a fundamental balance of things. A dichotomy of opposing extremes which balances out somewhere healthily in the middle. I am searching for a fiercely strong, passionate bond; built-up over time upon mutual trust, respect, and admiration. Submission is not about being abused; it is ultimately about self-empowerment.

I embrace these dichotomies and revel in their 'contradictions'. As humans we are, after all, often at odds with ourselves. I believe it natural to possess a fundamental desire to be cherished, respected, and loved - while simultaneously and perhaps inexplicably also wanting to be degraded, [ab]used, and objectified (to varying degrees and within reason, admittedly!). I seek to offer both - and all of the above - in kind.

If I've struck a chord, please don't hesitate to reach out so that we may carry on this exchange.

As for some basics: I am 29; 6' tall physically; attractive, height/weight proportionate, single. Preference for someone in the immediate area, but reasonably flexible if we're a good fit. I'm ideally searching for something ongoing and consistent. Not focused on labels as much as establishing solid chemistry. I'd love to be able to look forward to seeing one another once or twice a week for the time being. My own availability tends to gravitate towards later in the evenings (am admittedly a bit of a night owl), so an accommodating schedule would be most ideal.

Please change the email subject line to "awaiting your response" and include a photo of yourself to let me know you're interested and have taken the time to read this. I will respond promptly in-kind.

title: Older, sensual, flirty woman
text:
If I've noticed one thing as I've gotten older, it's that many of my peers (including some friends), are finding it more and more attractive to date younger and younger. So, I just wanted to get that out of the way, since I've noticed that I've never really had meaningful connections with young women. They are lovely people! But, still...women do get sexier as they age.

Anyway, forgive me for the weird rant! I'm tall and thin, pretty fit. I'm pretty smart and good-looking, have a career that I love doing what I've always wanted to do, which I still find somewhat surprising. I am a huge music fan (I won't start naming what, but if that doesn't interest you it's probably not going to work out), and am very literate. Whatever that means. 

If this seems at all intriguing, and if you are mature (over 40, the older the sexier),let me know...

I am tired of folks who are apparently perfect, too good for me and expect everyone else to be when they are not, folks who get mad at the slightest slight or mistake, and just waiting for you to make one mistake and write you off, I admit it all in the past. If you have flaws, issues or baggage s in life , don't be afraid to contact me. I am not here to judge. Laughing, understanding and forgiveness is a lot more fun, and revealing of your true self. title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. If you would like to Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

Who I am. . . I am first and foremost, a father to my three children who I adore. I love to watch them grow up and discover the world around them and to have them develop their own unique views of life in general. I love to travel the world and discover new cultures and see beautiful architecture, art, landscapes and people. I stare up at the sky in amazement and marvel at the Milky Way and think about our place in the universe. I tend to hold my feelings inside but cry easily (albeit hidden from view) when watching sad movies or witnessing acts of kindness. I love to draw, play instruments, dance, and sing -- though I am not very good at any of them! I love photography -- all types, landscape, events, portraiture, etc. and try to get out and photograph whenever I can. I love to run, cycle, lift weights, play baseball, soccer, and basketball -- anything outdoors. I love to spend time with family and friends, go to a local winery, an athletic event, a museum, a cook-out, etc. I love working in and out of my house as a handyman or a landscaper.

Why I am placing this ad. . . I have been in a long term relationship for over 20 years -- I call it that because it has not been a marriage, rather, a co-parenting relationship that has been void of intimacy except to conceive our children. I believe in the importance of honoring one's promises and stability in the home, so I have dutifully remained and lived a lonely existence surrounded by the trappings of an otherwise very successful and some would say fortunate life. To the last point, I agree, I should be very happy for everything in my life because there are so many others who are less fortunate. And yet, there are days where I would trade everything to find someone to love and who would love me completely.

So what am I looking for? I am looking for a woman to develop a friendship that might evolve into something more in time. While I will give you some particulars as to what I am looking for, beauty truly starts inside of you and comes in all shapes and sizes. She is between the ages of 35-65 (outside that range if the chemistry is right) of any ethnicity, who is drug and disease free, height and weight proportionate, kind, intelligent and willing to develop our friendship over time through email, chat, phone conversations; meeting for coffee or lunch; participating in activities in and around the Northern Virginia area. She is single or attached but looking for only one person to develop such a friendship.

I love the possibilities of what lies ahead... I am an optimist and one that believes everything happens for a reason. The choices we make, the paths we take, always lead us to new possibilities - it is up to us to reach out and take advantage of them.

"I need a friend who can tell me it's okay, someone who knows I'm not crazy for feeling this way.
I need a friend who needs one too; I say this now because I hope that this someone I speak of turns out to be you."

If you would be interested in starting a new journey with me, take that first step by contacting me and putting 'A New Friendship' in the subject line.

title: Do you have a crush on an older man at work?
text:
He's tall, handsome, fit, well-educated, assertive, and experienced. In other words, he's hot; and you can't seem to get him out of your head. The hint of gray hair at his temples makes you swoon. You feel giddy when he smiles at you and addresses you by name as he passes you in the hallway. You marvel at the way his blazer seems personally tailored just for his body and the way his pants seem to hang from his hips with an understated sexy appeal. What makes it even worse is that it's pretty obvious that he has a thing for you; but because of his position and his personal life, you're pretty sure that hooking up with him would be a major no-no.

Of course that doesn't change the fact that you have vivid fantasies about him constantly, and you're almost certain that he has the same frustratingly-hot cravings for you. He probably wants nothing more than to find you alone in the building late at night when he could sneak you into his office, lay you out on his desk, and have his way with you. And you would totally let him, too. You secretly wish you could tell him all your naughty fantasies so he could make them come true. You wish you could please him whenever he gets the urge, and you just know that you could be so very discreet so that no one would ever find out.

But alas, you also know that it will never happen. Although the consequences for getting caught would be minimal for you, they would be much greater for him. And although you know that you are temptingly cute, you also know that this man has it together, and he's not going to risk jeopardizing his fantastic career and his stable home life for a few minutes of ecstasy in the glow of your little naked body.

But what you may not have considered is that this same scenario isn't just happening at your workplace. It's happening everywhere. In some other office just down the street, or halfway across town, or in another state, there is another sweet young thing and another handsome older man who would love to hook up together but they don't dare because it would be too close for comfort. The risks and the consequences of getting caught would be too high.

So here's my suggestion: Since you and I don't work together, we have none of the same co-workers, and we have none of the same friends, you could take the place of the cutie that I've been flirting with in the hallway for months, and I could be that boss or executive that you've been crushing on. And since we don't move in the same circles, we need not worry about those silly office rules or taboos.

If this sounds appealing, I'd enjoy hearing from you. I'm slender, fit, healthy, and very tall. I'd prefer that you be in the immediate DC area--either that or a business traveler who visits here regularly. title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. If you would like to Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

text:
I am seeking a counselor/coach type person -- female only -- and almost surely unlicensed, for discussion and dialog about relationships. But I seek a situation where you are comfortable with me being undressed, fully exposed, during our meetings and discussion. That's not allowed for licensed counselors/therapists, but unlicensed persons have more flexibility. But physical exposure and expression facilitates verbal revealing.

I have posted before, and have found someone very helpful to talk to, whom I do see on occasion. But I could benefit from additional dialog, and I'd prefer someone closer to home, which for me means Montgomery County. I'd prefer a location in or close to Montgomery County -- upper NW DC is okay, as is nearby PG county.

I am a single man, middle-aged. Apart from discussion about relationships and dating, you'll find that in such other conversation as naturally arises, I'm intelligent, curious, well-educated, thoughtful. I can be pretty funny at times. 

I'd prefer contacts from counselors/coaches who are at least 30 or older, though a bit younger are welcome to make contact. But generally, more experience with life and dating, and closer to my experience, is likely to work better. In deep or personal conversations, I'm usually more at ease with white or Asian women (no disrespect to others, it's just my cultural base); but I am open to women of other ethnicities making contact and seeing where the mutual comfort level is. 

If you answer, please tell me about anything that you've done that's even kind of related -- former therapists and graduate students in counseling are encouraged to reply. But really any articulate, insightful, empathic woman may be right -- a businesswoman, an academic, military, also a massage therapist, nurses, female bartenders, or even an escort (but once again I am not seeking sex here, not intercourse or oral or any such thing here) -- someone with experience in listening to people on the job, may be right for this and for me.

If you're comfortable with it, you can provide a rough indication of where you are located. I would hope, if it works out, that this would be a once or twice a month type experience, ongoing for some time. I am really seeking someone in Montgomery County, MD.

I am not seeking a "Domme." If the connection works, a counselor/coach really develops a genuine concern for a client, and can, in a sense, celebrate with the client whatever progress the client makes in improving the quality of his life. title: If you read this post, it will make you smile :)
text:
hope someone read this, messages me, and we get to know someone awesome (you and I being the awesome). But, if not hopefully I got a smile out of you. 

Here's is a Q&A Session, I am answering what I believe what most of you would ask!

My stuff:

Q.: What are your beliefs?
A: My beliefs are that the one person you should always tip are the bathroom attendants. I mean seriously, who wants to work in the club bathroom on weekends... You deal with drunk people who piss all over the floor. Or drunk couples trying to hook up next to you, disgusting....

Q. What are you going to say when people ask where we met?
A. We'll just lie and say we actually met the first time we see each other in person (like a coffee shop).

Q. Where's your pic?
A. I'll reply with one, you should send one too

Q. What's your astrological sign?
A. Libra, but it doesn't really matter?

Q. Why are you here?
A. Looking for something more

Q. Are you always so vague?
A. No

Q. Are you a Craigslist serial killer? Violent person?
A. No, not at all! I wouldn't hurt a fly! 

Q. Do you think doing your ad like this will work?
A. I don't know, maybe, but like all things in life, you never know until you try. You may think later, "should I send this guy an e-mail?" Well, you won't ever know what would come out of it, unless you send the e-mail ;).

Q. Should I take this ad seriously?
A. Somewhat

Q. Do you think this ad is a clever idea?
A. I think the ad will do a remarkable job of isolating the type of women I find attractive from personality perspective

Q. You want me to read all this?
A. Why not? You're here, because you are looking for something, bored or both. If you're bored, I really don't see the point in NOT reading this.

Q. Do you smoke or do drugs?
A. Not a fan of smelling like burnt tobacco, nor a fan of drugs that cures boredom artificially. I don't need drugs to have a good time! :)

Q. Single-mothers?
A. Not really, I'm really a person that enjoys my time and honestly my lack of responsibility outside of myself. Not to mention, I really enjoy not having kids, but I absolutely adore them.

Q. What type of girl are you looking for?
A. Definitely a positive person who is fun to be around. Nothing is more important than surrounding yourself with positive energy. I've been told that I am also considered fun to be around. I live an active life, I love walking around new cities, biking. Therefore, I would want someone who is also active and reasonably fit. I'm also in my 20s, and looking for a girl who is also in her 20s.

Q. Okay, okay, do you have kids?
A. None I'm aware of!

Q. Umm really?
A. That was a joke

Q. Jokes are usually funny, you know
A. No, I don't know

Q. What do you enjoy doing?
A. Now? Really? I can tell you one thing, not walking in the park. I don't have anything against walking in parks. But, for some reason, that always ends up on internet dating ad. We both know that is not true

Q. Do you have your own place?
A. I'm 31, I can't imagine not having my own place

Q. What type of person are you hoping to meet?
A. An open-minded, intelligent, kind-hearted woman, loves exploring new places, and isn't afraid to try new things.

Q. Do you have a job?
A. Where do you meet people? Really?

Q. This is Craigslist?
A. Oh, my bad. Good point. Yes, and a pretty good one.

Q. What is your biggest pet-peeve?
A. Oh...ohhh...I hate cliches, especially dating ones. "I want someone that knows what they want out of life", "I'm tired of games","I want a "REAL" man", "It's 20 (insert whatever new year it is) and it's time...". Seriously, this is word-soup on a small scale. They're sentences that seem to say something, but really say nothing at all.

Q. Do you like zombies?
A. I was into it way before they became mainstream

Q. So do you hate them now?
A. Hipster I am not, Walking Dead the show, Dawn of the Dead, Resident Evil, are some of the best story-telling there is

Q. Are you here just looking for sex like everyone else here on Craigslist?
A. If I was, this wouldn't be the way I'd go about it.

Q. What type of music do you like?
A. I grew up on Hip Hop, and still love it, but now I'm an EDM head! Been to Echostage several times and have seen Hardwell, David Guetta, Afrojack, Benny Benassi, there's nothing like raging in an EDM concert.

Q. Favorite Artist?
A. Banksy! If you didn't know, he's the one who did the work above.

Q. Do you date outside your race?
A. Sure, but I believe statistically speaking my race is the least desired interracial group. I'm Asian, and most girls seem to stereotype us as short, geeky, skinny nerds. I don't blame them, that's how the media portrays them, and what the eye constantly sees, the brain is trained to stereotype. That's not me, I'm 5'10, play basketball, go to the gym, explore cities, and I spend a lot of time outdoors. Yet a lot of people think that just because I'm Asian, I play video-games, booksmart, and won spelling bees in HS. Glen from Walking Dead is paving the way in changing this image!

Q. Is it because people are racist?
A. Probably not

Q. Why are you single?
A. Why are you reading this?

Q. Have you ever met anyone online
A. Yup

Q. Great first date?
A. Ugh, I suck at creative dates, and not to sound like a sap, but if I really like someone I don't care what we do as long as we do it together

Q. Should I send you a message?
A. Yes, if you are a cool girl who wants to meet a cool, genuine, and down to earth guy.

title: I always put the seat back down!
text:
Hello there, glad that I have your attention! I'm giving this a shot, so bear with me, besides, you never know what may happen! Anyhow, I would characterize myself as an outgoing, energetic, charismatic person. I tend to be very passionate about the things that move me, and love to explore and share new experiences. I would like to think that I have grown and matured, that I have become a bit wiser as well, meaning that I know what it is that I seek in a partner. In an ideal world, she would be my friend and confidant. She would be the one that I share my hopes, dreams and fears with, and yet she would be able to challenge and motivate me. However, the converse holds true. I would want to be there for my special someone when she is feeling down. I would want to be able to hold her tight and offer reassurance, and to be her rock when she needs support. If all of this sounds corny, then too bad! That's just the way I am.
Now, if you are readily annoyed by someone who prefers to stay active, I may not be the guy for you. While I certainly enjoy good movies and shows on Netflix, I'm not going to be the one that sits on his ass all weekend watching sports. I would much rather be trying new and interesting things, even if it means stepping outside of my comfort zone. Would you? 
I thoroughly enjoy cooking and can certainly hold my own in the kitchen. I also clean! I am by no means a slob, it's just the way that I am. So there you have it. A guy that cooks, cleans, and doesn't sit around the house all day with one hand stuffed in his pants. Impressed? Wait, there's more! I fix stuff too (very handy) I own a ton of tools AND know how to use them!
What all of this boils down to is that I am just a simple man. The finer things that life has to offer are fantastic, without a doubt, but I believe it's the intangible ones that can offer us the most joy and contentment. I truly miss a gorgeous smile and a beautiful pair of eyes locked with mine, the kind that give me goosebumps and butterflies. I miss meaningful conversations that go well into the wee hours of the night, and a longing to be so close to someone that it hurts. Although I believe myself to be attractive, and confident in who I am, this isn't a quest for a Barbie Doll. Truth be told, if you are really curvy or plus-sized, then bonus points for you! I like what I like, that's all I'll say. Physical beauty is great and such, but there is plenty more that comes from within. Thanks for staying with me, hope to hear from you soon!
