I see you all the time in my day-to-day wanderings. There are many of you out there, but most of you are so quiet, shy, and introverted that it's not easy to penetrate your solitary shell and catch your attention. You carry a book with you everywhere, and you are often so absorbed in your reading that you don't notice the admiring looks you get from older men like me who are beginning to grey at the temples and who have a special weakness for intelligent, thoughtful, introspective young women.

I see you sitting there in the park, on the metro, or in a coffee shop, reading, absorbed in another world, completely oblivious to me as I study you as if you were a Renoir, a Degas, or a Botticelli. My eyes trace the profile of your delicate chin, your sweet little nose, and your cute girlish figure. My hands mentally caress the softness of your pretty hair, a few strands of which have come loose from your pony tail and keep falling into your field of view as you brush them back absentmindedly. Briefly, something distracts you, and you look up just long enough to lock eyes with me. Your eyes are bright and deep, and they look at me with a hint of reproach for staring at you. I smile, and your lips form just the slightest hint of a response, but then you quickly return to your book, refusing to give me the satisfaction of any obvious acknowledgement.

You don't like it when creepy older men stare at you, but somehow when the man is tall, fit, and attractive the whole formula shifts, and you are no longer sure what you like and what you don't. This man looks to be in his mid forties and has an almost paternal gentleness in his demeanor, but you also sense an attraction, a palpable chemistry that is not at all paternal. You noticed a ring on his finger, but it doesn't seem to bother you. You try to keep reading, but you find yourself rereading the same lines over and over. Part of you is annoyed that he has distracted you from your book, and you wish he would go away; but another part of you is secretly intrigued, wondering what would happen if he were to get up, walk over, and sit down next to you. Your heart beats a little faster, and you are suddenly conscious of how you look, the outfit that you picked out for today, the arrangement of your hair.

Suddenly, he stands up. Your heart throbs in your chest as you grip your book and stare at the jumble of words on the page. Out of the corner of your eye you can see his polished leather shoes as he approaches you and stops. What is he doing? What is he waiting for? You want to look up at him a second time, but you are too shy; and the next thing you know, he is walking away. Finally, you look up, but it is too late. You watch the back of his blazer and his well-fitting jeans as he disappears into the crowd.

I understand your shyness. Perhaps that's why you're here on craigslist. Tell me something about yourself that you think I might like to know. Please note, I am not interested in anyone who is underage. You must be an adult.

title: Homebody, Not Couch Potato
text:
Single white male, age 56, 5' 8". (Yes, really single.) Conversionalist. Intelligent. Creative. Witty. Homebody. 

Homebody does not equal couch potato. I'm not passive in the face of life, I have an active mind and I do leave the house from time-to-time. Just not into the forever-on-the-go lifestyle.

I am a non-conventional man who appears rather conventional. In earlier years I've often been mistaken for a lawyer, a state of affairs which is only likely to become worse as I just graduated law school at age 56, and if/when I pass the bar I will be a lawyer. I'll be good at law, but I'll never be a lawyer at heart. I'm much more an artist, engineer, and humanist, even with the law degree.

I am seeking a woman who is intelligent, reflective, reasonably attractive and fit, introspective without being moody -- but who is not too much into travel, not into whirlwinds of activity. I'd like to meet a woman who often prefers to spend her down time at home.

Fun is laughter and I miss having someone to laugh with. I like to observe life -- my life, other lives, the life of the world, and poke fun at it. Few things give me more pleasure than laughing. I'm introspective and insightful. I want a partner who can share a good conversation and find that an excellent way to share an evening together. Sitting in a room together, and each reading a book in silence, is also a wonderful way to be together.

I am definitely not "type A," yet I am very busy professionally. But socially I am not the "always on the go" type with an overextended social calendar. I would really like to find a woman who enjoys being home, cuddled up watching a movie or just having great conversation. That said, I wouldn't mind a woman who coaxes me to go for a nice walk or catch an occasional show.

So if you're can be happy with a type B+, then, as George Harrison wrote, "write you number on my wall and maybe you will get a call from me..."

I'm seeking a woman who is:
- intelligent, most likely college educated, though I'm not hung-up on fancy paperwork
- loves conversation and sharing ideas and dreams and thoughts; you're imaginative and creative
- but also has a very practical, pragmatic, grounded side; realistic, can meet head on with daily life -- a woman with sound executive judgment at home and on the street
- not very religious
- no taller than 5' 9"
- sane -- I would soooo like to date a woman who is sane (I will try to return the favor) ;-)
- young enough to plausibly consider having a kid or two

I could say much more about me, but I'd prefer you ask some questions. 

Put your college major in the subject line, just to filter out spam.

title: Looking for a tall lady who's on the up and up
text:
Well hello!

The fact that you're reading my ad can imply any number of things, but I'm going to keep an open mind. You don't have to convince me that you're not a loser by explaining in exhaustive detail how you just happened to be bored and browsing ads for a laugh. You don't have to tell me how many weirdos you've corresponded with. I'm posting because I figure someone worthwhile might reply, and it could be you. It would be foolish to post an ad and then expect everyone who replies to have something wrong with them, right? But I suppose I should lay out my deal-breakers up front.

1. No kids. I want them, but I want them to be mine.

2. No atheists and no one who is vehemently anti-Christian. I'm Catholic. I like myself that way, and I like to speak my mind about it.

3. No one who's too cookie-cutter. You know how you feel about guys and their shirtless pics? That's how I feel when you list your degrees or show me pics of you with the kids in Africa or on the Great Wall of China or whatever. Where you have been does not make you who you are. Preferably you've taken a moment or two to be alone with your thoughts and determine what makes you tick. Also, intelligence is so much more attractive than education, because these days you can educate an idiot, but you can't make them think.

4. No adrenaline junkies. Let's indulge in intellectual pursuits, shall we?

Jeez, I'm so demanding, right? Who do I think I am? Well, nobody special. Not really. I like me, and I think I'm great and all that, but I mean, I'm a very flawed human just like anyone. My life is decidedly in the midst of an upswing, however, and I'd like to be able to share it with someone special. I'm saving money, building credit, writing my third book and getting into shape. What's not to like? I hope to have a house within a year and be slightly more famous than I am now. If that doesn't happen, things will still be better.

I enjoy creative pursuits, silly and intellectual humor, philosophy, music, movies, occasional TV shows, long walks in the woods and old video games. Preferably you like a few of the same things. Props if you can talk Star Trek or heavy metal. :P Also, props if you're over six foot.

If I haven't left you scratching your head because you can't figure me out, you should probably send me an email. What have you got to lose?

title: Daddy daughter role play
text:
Once upon a time, there was a daughter who was too pretty, too precious and too perfect for words. She knew this to be the case and she flaunted it wherever she went. All the boys wanted to date her. All the girls wanted to be her. Some of the girls wanted to date her, too, but that's a story for another time.

The girl dated lots of boys. More often than not, she didn't really care about the boys. She would just let them buy her gifts and shower her with affection. When the daughter was done with the boys, she
would cast them aside like refuse. The boys were devastated but, for the most part, they were thankful for the time they had with the daughter. But not all of them were so magnanimous.

The daughter's Daddy was mostly oblivious to her behavior. He though his daughter was the perfect princess and could do no wrong. He was very proud of his daughter and bragged about her whenever given the opportunity. She was, after all, an only child. "Prodigal daughter" doesn't begin to describe her. Technically, she wasn't his daughter; she was his step-daughter. Her mother had died years ago, and the Daddy raised the daughter as her own.

Then one day, everything changed. The daughter's previous boy toy came to call after school. He was furious at having been replaced by a newer, shinier model. The Daddy was not home and the daughter made the grave mistake of letting this boy inside the house. I won't go in to the details of what happened, but it suffices to say the boy demonstrated his immaturity in spades. It was about to get violent when the Daddy came home.

Now the Daddy is not a violent man, but he is a large man. And he can use his deep, booming voice to intimidate even the most stalwart of people. He saw what the boy was about to do to his daughter and put an immediate stop to it. The boy was sent packing, the daughter was in tears and the Daddy was left to pick up the pieces.

The two sat down, Daddy and daughter, to discuss what had happened. The daughter was so distraught that she told the Daddy everything. She was brutally honest in describing how she used her beauty to manipulate all those boys and how she treated them like trash when she was done with them. The Daddy was horrified - this was not how he raised his daughter. But internally, he conceded that she was, indeed, her mother's daughter. Her mother, you see, used to use and abuse boys, too - until she met the Daddy.

After the daughter had calmed down and was reassured that she was safe, the Daddy knew what he had to do. As he had once broken her mother of this behavior, so must he now break his daughter. He called the unknowing daughter over to him, turned her over his knee and spanked her - HARD. He spanked her once for each of the boys that she had used and abused. And when he was done, he went through the litany twice more. The first time was for the boys; the second time was the mother; and the third time was for him.

The daughter was shocked. She had never been spanked before, not by her mother and CERTAINLY not by the Daddy. She was so taken aback, she didn't know how to react. She laid there, her bottom red and throbbing, unsure of what to do. Seconds turned to minutes as neither one moved or said a word. Finally, driven by some insane combination of love, fear, loyalty, devotion, submission and even lust, she reached up and kissed her Daddy.

This is the end of part 1. Contact me for part 2.

My philosophy about life is simple: be passionate about what you do and enjoy life and love to the fullest I will listen to almost anything music is my passion I love anything from soft rock to trap music a good bottle of wine, good food, good company and a good laugh is my idea of a great evening, either with my loving lady. For as much as I enjoy doing things with and for others, and being out with other people, I also greatly enjoy the individual company of the lady in my life, to dedicating time just to be with her, and to continue to develop that intimate relationship between us. I am equally comfortable getting dressed up and going out for an evening as I am staying at home, watching movies and eating freshly popped popcorn while cuddling and holding the love of my life in my arms.

I am very logical, and action-oriented; yet also very loving, passionate, loyal and driven to build and nurture relationships. I am also a problem solver, not a problem generator; I tend to see the glass as half full; and I'm one who tries to diffuse conflict as opposed to being disagreeable and arguing. In my humble opinion, life is simply too short to waste one's emotional energy on needless things. Words that describe me are respectful, open, honest, sincere, communicative, trusting, caring, affectionate, loving, passionate, sensual, energetic, and fun loving. I also possess a bit of a dry/witty/ sense of humor. I can also be very quiet and laid back about what I do, and how I do it...

I am a person who believes that "backwards is not an option," and who tends to take a "nothing ventured, nothing gained" and "you never know until you try" type approach to life. I am a "what you see is what you get" type person, and I say what I mean and mean what I say. For as much as I can be an intellectual, I tend to write from the heart, as I find that to be very reflective of my soul.


I Always been the Bad Boy/ Gentleman type. I've been in business for myself mostly.. Co owner of a record label and I attracted all the lost boys! kinda like a modern day Robin Hood and we created a lot of unwanted drama in our lives some people would call us a group of ruff necks or organized criminals. I was always very popular I got whatever I wanted. I dated the wrong types and partied nonstop. I was always financially secure or better than that I was well off I never missed a party some people would say I was the party. I stayed in trouble with the law and I guess the more trouble I got in the more popular I became. I was always surrounded by dozens of people but yet always alone. I became the King of a world that was full of fake people and I myself was the fakest of all. I lost myself and it took along time to realize just how fake everyone in that world is.

I helped put Atlanta on the map with Hip/Hop-Rap way before Outkast, Godie Mob, Lil Jon, Luda, Future Kilo and others but I had working relation with them early in their careers.. I had nothing real and I had abandoned the people who truly mattered. I was not being a true father to my kids and I was betraying myself because I wasn't allowing the good things to be part of my life. So one day I woke up I decided I wanted more and I knew it was time to make a change but I didn't know how? I decided to leave everything and everybody I knew and make a fresh start I decided it was time to start being the man I needed to be and to stop playing basically it was time to grow up and it was also time to be the father I had never been I want to find someone that is real, loving and understanding. I want a normal life that I can be proud of like a loving family that is grounded with morals and values.. I am very passionate and very loyal and committed man to the people I care for I have just spent to much time caring for the wrong people. And I think out of the East! Free And Accepted Mason.. Boaz! I am a type A person and I had it all but I walked away to find what to me means much more and that is someone real to share a normal purpose driven life with.

The script of my life has been rewritten, and I am now moving into the next phase of my life, which is something that I had never envisioned. However, Life experiences has taught me to "adjust and adapt," I will not let my current situation define me or hold me back. Rather, I will rise above it and move forward. To be specific, my life is in transition due to two reasons. First, Change and New Challenges Transition, I also presume that anyone I meet is also interested in starting a serious relationship and seeing where it goes. As such, I don't view my current situation as an impediment to starting a relationship that could became long term and that potentially could lead to marriage.

My desire is to get together and to have a conversation, as I greatly respect and enjoy the company of a lady. My intent is to get out and about, and to do so in a way that keeps expenses down given my present situation. I was recently laid off "But I was lucky to find a job already" God is good! and is in the process of moving back to Ga from DC area.. Even though living comfortable is ideal.. I have had some life challenges so if you are after material gains I'm not for you.. I have great vision regarding where a relationship can go; however, I do have a great deal of self-respect, integrity, honor and morals, and a great deal of respect for others, and know better than to engage in behaviors that are destructive to a relationship. Some may call that old-fashioned, however; that's okay with me, as I believe that that chivalry is not dead!

As I expressed previously, I wish to find a lady whose values are similar to my own; and I am going to remain very open relative to whom I meet at this stage of my life.. I am a nonsmoker (of any kind); drug and disease free; neat, clean and organized; and am only interested in someone who is also a nonsmoker; who is both drug and disease free; who is not a drama queen; who is not into mind games; or who is messy, unkempt or disorganized, So having a great personality being sexy, fit
loving and very understanding career driven is key!
B.. A.. S.. I.. C.. S... L.. O.. V.. E..

B- be who you are
A- appreciate your partner
I- invest time in building a foundation, Rome was not built in 1 day.
C- communicate, compromise & cherish each other
S- share your goals with each other and strive to live life with each other build a empire
~
L- love unconditionally, with no regrets ever
O- open your mind to a partner's opinion and respect them as an individual
V- value GOD and have a place for him
E- embrace the beauty that a couple shares with all the good and bad ~ enjoy the journey 




If what has been expressed above is of interest to you, or has struck a chord with you, then please reply and tell me a little bit about yourself, namely tell me something about your life story. And please don't respond and say something along the lines of "tell me more about yourself," as I believe that I have discussed quite lot about myself already. If you are interested in me, it's your turn to write to me! Please know that I will read and respond to what you write about yourself and your situation. A picture with your reply would be greatly appreciated, as would a description of yourself, so please be real. Also, please put the phrase "LOVING" in the subject line to weed out spam.

title: The Quest for the Holy Geek
text:
The year. . .is 2016

The place. . . is the suburban hellscape of Northern Virginia, where the last crumbling vestiges of a once proud, but now forgotten civilization slumber, forlornly awaiting the light of reason to shine once again, and banish the terror-stricken paranoia that vanquished it.

Join our intrepid champion on his quixotic and probably ultimately futile quest to find! . . .what's mentioned in the title.

Our hero starts his adventure at Computer Castle where the noble Windows Wizards and Software Sorceresses do battle against the horrendous Hacker Hellions (while the Linux Luminaries look on in indomitable indifference). Our plucky protagonist bravely does battle with these wicked fiends using his Staff of Fire Wall and Intrusion Detection Wards and lo! They are vanquished, and peace reigns once again.

Then the gallant geek-seeker stumbles upon the dreaded Cave. . .of RELIGIOSITY! He is immediately assailed by mythical bearded white men who bombard him with creepily specific sex advice and deplorable ideas concerning the treatment of women and slaves. But our hero stands strong against their ancient and obsolete ideologies and defeats them with his mighty Protection from Stupidity and Word of Reason spells. The bearded white men are then banished back to the realm of myth and fairy tale. . .where they belong.

Finally the audacious adventurer strides victoriously into the fey land of love where awaits for him the most holiest of geeks, the queen amongst her kind, whose discovery had been prophesized since the dawn of time (the time of the creation of this narrative anyway). The two embraced, and did other things the descriptions of which are ill-suited for a general audience, and happiness reigned in the world of them, and life was good.

title: The musings of an ideal mind
text:
Have you ever thought to yourself, you know what I really need in my life? A geek boyfriend. If I ever needed my computer fixed without paying those outrageous Geek Squad prices, he could do that for me! If I ever wanted to be subjected to an angry, passionate rant about how 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons is the end of the world as we know it, he could do that for me! If I ever wanted to learn all the intricate minutiae of why Windows decides that painting a blue screen on my monitor full of incomprehensibly arcane gibberish is a good idea, well by hell! I bet he could do that too!

Have you ever pondered while weak and weary, you know what would really increase the output of my economic utility function? An intellectual boyfriend. Someone with whom I could have a meaningful discussion on Aristotelian logic or Locke's concept of a social contract without him looking like a deer stuck facing down the headlights of an onrushing Canyonero F Series.

Have you ever mused in abject wonderment, you know what would really mend my metaphysical malady? An atheist boyfriend. Someone who outgrew having imaginary friends in childhood and someone for whom the realization that he is utterly alone in an unfathomable and uncaring universe hasn't been enough to reduce him to a quivering pile of mental sludge seeking speciously spurious solace in the cloying embrace of a Bronze Age mythology.

Have you ever resolutely ruminated, you know what would really remediate my romantic predicament? A nice boyfriend. Someone who treats me like an actual human being with my own thoughts, desires, goals and hopes for the future. Someone who wants an actual serious relationship rather than just the mutual (or perhaps not so mutual) slackening of salacious stimuli (though, you know, that's fun too).

And finally, have you ever cogitatingly contemplated, you know what I just can't get enough of? Anaphora. Then look no further! (Well, look a little bit further, I'm almost done I swear!) Because if you answered an exuberantly ecstatic "YES!" to these questions and the thoughts expressed herein so eerily mirror your own that you perhaps secretly suspect me of having some sort of eldritch, alien mind reading device because seriously how the hell else could this guy have written such effulgently eloquent prose captured straight from the deepest, innermost recesses of my mind, then it would probably behoove you contact me, and hell, I wouldn't mind it either.

title: looking for a woman who is ready for marriage
text:
You know what it's like when you go on vacation, and you're surounded by new sights and sounds and people... and inside you feel like you can just step out of all of your usual roles and routines and step into a different side of yourself that can experience things in different ways and do things you would never normally think of doing... someone once said that it's easy to be in a relationship when you're traveling to some beautiful, exotic location, because you don't have all those routine, day-to-day responsibilities holding you back, but then when the two of you come back home to your job, your commute, your obligations... well, that's the true test of whether the relationship will last...

But sometimes you meet someone, and just being with them can make the burden of all those responsibilities melt away... because you connect with them on such a deep level that you feel completely free to just be yourself, to open up and be vulnerable, because you know that this other person is strong and kind and giving and wants to build a life and relationship with you... and you know that, no matter where you go or what you is going on around you, you can feel perfectly at home and at peace with this person... with me, that is the kind of relationship I want and am looking for, and if you want the same, write to me and let me know... 

And, really, beauty is common... what matters to me is that a woman is compassionate, genuine, unpretentious and has a sense of humor about life and herself... that she is ready to open up to someone new... and once we get to know each other, then later, maybe six months from now, you'll look back on that time we first met, and realize that this connection didn't just start there, because it feels almost like we have always known each other, and were just waiting for that right moment to meet... but let's not wait any longer.

title: Got Short Girl Problems?
text:

title: Seeking a friend (and perhaps a freak) for the end of the world
text:
Please forgive the Steve Carell reference but even though I really dislike his brand of humor, it seemed appropriate. A CL maven I am certainly not and after reading a few posts on both sides of the fence (w4m and m4w and to be honest, casual and missed encounters for shock/humor value) it seemed reasonable to throw myself out there. Please read the entire post and I hope it generates interest and inspiration.
I've lost my soul mate; call it a 50/50 split with respect to causation but a 90/10 distribution of sadness with me on the heavy end. She is off to be happily alone for the first time in her life and I'm left with a chasm that for the last year has seemed all but uncrossable and unfillable. While we were very different people, I found in her the yin to my yang and in middle age (after a previous 17 year marriage with two wonderful children which ended with my ex- deciding that she's a lesbian, but we're better friends now than we ever were when we were married) the first true love of my life. Our biggest problem was, at its root, a mutual lack of trust that spawned a lack of communication. Our issues came from very different places, but both were real and ultimately fatal to the relationship. From possibly a foolish position of being a giver, I agreed to a divorce without any struggle and entered the twilight but there are resources. I found a true key for me and my issues but found them too late. Ain't that a shame!!! Coming to grips with one's own foibles is a good thing though, as long as you keep the shoes on the right feet; life's a journey. 
Well; there was the serious stuff, so how about the other side? I'm a W/M, 6'1, 200, athletic (I'm a long distance cyclist and teach cycle spin five times a week), have a PhD in Materials Engineering, am drug and disease free, love to cook and eat wonderful food, love wine, make excellent bourbon whiskey and last and certainly not least, adore physical intimacy. What that really means I can't adequately explain because that was where the worst of the betrayal was for me with the loss of my soul mate. For me, though, it is one of those things that I know immediately. I'm a huge believer in chemistry and completely understand the need for honesty. It takes me about one kiss (not a peck on the cheek yet but anything's possible) to know it in my heart and soul. I'm trusting now to a fault and am easily hurt as witnessed by having met another woman who absolutely swept me off my feet only for me to find that she was actually in love with her career and had no real place for anyone else in her life. 
Well, there it is. If you made it this far, go a step further. Please respond, put soulmate in the title and include a photo please. Nothing past PG-17, please unless you want the same from me. I will respond in kind. Age is unimportant to me but please be at least 40-ish and under 60-ish but I'm flexible and certainly open to discussion. Thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you!

title: Friends First!!!
text:
Here is what we men think when we encounter a woman who says "friends first." She is either undesirable or she does not like sex or really want a sexual relationship.

Our experience with women shows that a woman knows if she is sexually attracted to a man nearly as quickly as a man knows, maybe 15 minutes vs 15 milliseconds. But still fast. Dating for a month without getting physical should sound all sorts of bells and whistles. He: "Is she even interested in me sexually, or is this what she really wants?" She: "Does he find me attractive at all? Why hasn't he TRIED anything? Is he gay or doesn't he LIKE me?" It seems to me that if they both are not groping pretty early on that they are doomed never to do so.

On the other hand, it may very well be the fruits of her experience that make a woman gun shy about sex, and for good reason. She has given her heart and her body and she has gotten hurt, badly, maybe more than once. And she thinks that friends first will keep her safe. But what happens when she meets a guy she is attracted to? Either she puts her fears aside or she holds back. If she holds back, she knows that she risks losing him. If she gives in to the urge, she risks getting hurt again.

But here's the deal: there is no such thing as a relationship with no chance of getting hurt, ALL relationships carry that peril. And putting off the day of first sexual encounter does NOT reduce the chances of getting hurt, it only reduces the chances of actually starting something.

More than half the women I have ever had sex with started on the first date. It was an acknowledgment that we both wanted each other, that we shared "lust" for each other. And we were both SURE that we were friends first, even in a few hours or less! Those beginnings that never went anywhere would never have gone anywhere even if we had waited. "Friends first" is an artifice that can only cost beginning a relationship that may go bad, or one that may go very well indeed.

On the other hand, maybe friends first is just talk, a barrier to see if a guy may be interested at all. But if you don't share a photo, what is there for a guy to be interested in? It's all barrier, with no purpose other than to scare away guys who really want a real relationship.

Finally, if you are a woman looking to enter into a platonic relationship with a man, you should not answer ANY of these ads, as all men want a sexual relationship, at least those who post C-L ads. And C-L does have a "strictly platonic" section for those who want that.

My 2c worth.

I can only wonder how long before some Craigslist troll decides to flag my thoughts!

P.S., this analysis is pretty sharp! If you don't think so, you are probably not smart enough for me! Yeah, and I know this is a pretty boorish thing to say. "Whatever!"

What I would really like is for some woman to reply to this "ad" and say "You know, you are right! Ready to move slowly on this. thanks.

title: Good Man in search of Great Woman
text:
Hi!

Looking for some kind of relationship? I am. What am I looking for? A girl-friend, mate, partner in crime, lover, friend with benefits (I really don't care what you call it, but it's NOT occasional, it's often (sometimes known as committed (OK, maybe not immediately but ultimately))) ("wife" is not included in the list because that is not a wish, it's a possible outcome).

I am a divorced Caucasian man, 5'9", 156#, senior, gray hair, blue eyes, specs, ex-pat New Yorker, not religious, smart/witty/sharp/funny (modest!), graduate degree, first career (from which I am retired) as a computer consultant, moved to DC area to get closer to the seats of power, and have written a BOOK. I also volunteer at the Smithsonian.

I am a good conversationalist and I am interested in most things. I am also a pretty good listener. My musical tastes range from Prokofiev and Rachmaninoff (20th century Russians) to Gershwin and Bob Dylan. I like GOOD pop and classic rock n roll. I read lots: history, economics, and occasional OLD novels. I am politically liberal but open-minded and pretty disgusted with what all is going on these days.

I like loud and crackly thunder storms. I like fireplaces and campfires. I like the outdoors and "nature" in the warm months. I like Indian food, especially Banjara in NYC. I like bakery bread (aka real bread). I like good olive oil with my good bread. I like chocolate babka. I like good chocolate (not the over-rated Godiva). I like smart people, people who can THINK. And I like being in love (especially with a woman who loves me in return).

What kind of woman am I looking for? If you like my looks and I like yours, we have a good start (big women call my taste in women "petite" or "slender" or "in shape"). If we enjoy each other's company on that first meeting, we are that much closer. I am not afraid to jump in; worst case scenario is I get hurt; I am a grown-up and I can handle reverses of fortune. I'd prefer a woman who is not terrified of getting involved again. I don't care what your race is or your age; if we click, we click.

You have a lot about me. I'd like at least a photo (or a good description if you need to remain private before we meet).

title: Successful mid-30s businessman seeks YOUNGER woman with PERKY BREASTS
text:
I am a successful businessman in my mid 30s who is most attracted to young women with perky breasts (typically B cup or smaller). I work a lot of hours and am seeking a companion to spoil and have fun with in my downtime. I prefer to date younger women (under 30), but I can be flexible on age.

Please submit a photograph of yourself if you are interested.

title: Prefer to date OLDER MEN? Exec seeks younger companion
text:

NO MINORS.

text:
Please accept my thanks in advance for reading my posting.
A Single Black Male Searching For True Love And Understanding...
5'11 230 Fit, Dimples, Bald Head, And A Few Tats.. Heart Of Gold
And I know this is A LONG SHOT... But they say have faith of a mustard seed...
I'm currently is in Atlanta But love to travel and thinking outside of my box..
Just moved back from DC/NYC I'm a union construction worker..

My goal is to find someone whom I don't want to be without for the rest of my life, as opposed to finding someone whom I want to be with right now.


I am a hopeful romantic who believes that the right two people can bring out the best in each other, as they complement each other, and their relationship will be synergistic. I wish to find a lady whose values are similar to my own; and who also believes that a monogamous long-term relationship is based on respect; love; trust; honest, open and frequent communications; and faith. I wish to find a lady who wants to create an opportunity together; who wants to share life's journey, with its excitement and uncertainty; who appreciates what a loving relationship offers, and that just like a beautiful garden, it takes tending to maintain, and to make it grow; and finally, who is right at home applying the philosophy of "adjust and adapt" to make things better for our life together. I am also one who greatly enjoys holding hands, hugging, cuddling, and sharing long, loving and passionate kisses with the woman that I love. I am one who is not short on affection, and believe strongly that one receives even more than one gives in this regard.

I am a service oriented person, especially to the lady in my life. I greatly enjoy doing things with and for others; and am a firm believer that one receives much more than one gives through service. For example, I greatly enjoy helping in the kitchen with cooking, and view it as both a pleasurable entity onto itself, as it a great creative outlet; as well as a means of service to others, especially to the lady in my life. While it may sound silly, I think that putting your arm around someone and giving them a kiss on the check while they are cooking is a very pleasurable experience. And, I like to have it done to me as well. 

My philosophy about life is simple: be passionate about what you do and enjoy life and love to the fullest I will listen to almost anything music is my passion I love anything from soft rock to trap music a good bottle of wine, good food, good company and a good laugh is my idea of a great evening, either with my loving lady. For as much as I enjoy doing things with and for others, and being out with other people, I also greatly enjoy the individual company of the lady in my life, to dedicating time just to be with her, and to continue to develop that intimate relationship between us. I am equally comfortable getting dressed up and going out for an evening as I am staying at home, watching movies and eating freshly popped popcorn while cuddling and holding the love of my life in my arms.

I am very logical, and action-oriented; yet also very loving, passionate, loyal and driven to build and nurture relationships. I am also a problem solver, not a problem generator; I tend to see the glass as half full; and I'm one who tries to diffuse conflict as opposed to being disagreeable and arguing. In my humble opinion, life is simply too short to waste one's emotional energy on needless things. Words that describe me are respectful, open, honest, sincere, communicative, trusting, caring, affectionate, loving, passionate, sensual, energetic, and fun loving. I also possess a bit of a dry/witty/ sense of humor. I can also be very quiet and laid back about what I do, and how I do it...

I am a person who believes that "backwards is not an option," and who tends to take a "nothing ventured, nothing gained" and "you never know until you try" type approach to life. I am a "what you see is what you get" type person, and I say what I mean and mean what I say. For as much as I can be an intellectual, I tend to write from the heart, as I find that to be very reflective of my soul.


I Always been the Bad Boy/ Gentleman type. I've been in business for myself mostly.. Co owner of a record label and I attracted all the lost boys! kinda like a modern day Robin Hood and we created a lot of unwanted drama in our lives some people would call us a group of ruff necks or organized criminals. I was always very popular I got whatever I wanted. I dated the wrong types and partied nonstop. I was always financially secure or better than that I was well off I never missed a party some people would say I was the party. I stayed in trouble with the law and I guess the more trouble I got in the more popular I became. I was always surrounded by dozens of people but yet always alone. I became the King of a world that was full of fake people and I myself was the fakest of all. I lost myself and it took along time to realize just how fake everyone in that world is.

I helped put Atlanta on the map with Hip/Hop-Rap way before Outkast, Godie Mob, Lil Jon, Luda, Future Kilo and others but I had working relation with them early in their careers.. I had nothing real and I had abandoned the people who truly mattered. I was not being a true father to my kids and I was betraying myself because I wasn't allowing the good things to be part of my life. So one day I woke up I decided I wanted more and I knew it was time to make a change but I didn't know how? I decided to leave everything and everybody I knew and make a fresh start I decided it was time to start being the man I needed to be and to stop playing basically it was time to grow up and it was also time to be the father I had never been I want to find someone that is real, loving and understanding. I want a normal life that I can be proud of like a loving family that is grounded with morals and values.. I am very passionate and very loyal and committed man to the people I care for I have just spent to much time caring for the wrong people. And I think out of the East! Free And Accepted Mason.. Boaz! I am a type A person and I had it all but I walked away to find what to me means much more and that is someone real to share a normal purpose driven life with.

The script of my life has been rewritten, and I am now moving into the next phase of my life, which is something that I had never envisioned. However, Life experiences has taught me to "adjust and adapt," I will not let my current situation define me or hold me back. Rather, I will rise above it and move forward. To be specific, my life is in transition due to two reasons. First, Change and New Challenges Transition, I also presume that anyone I meet is also interested in starting a serious relationship and seeing where it goes. As such, I don't view my current situation as an impediment to starting a relationship that could became long term and that potentially could lead to marriage.

My desire is to get together and to have a conversation, as I greatly respect and enjoy the company of a lady. My intent is to get out and about, and to do so in a way that keeps expenses down given my present situation. I was recently laid off "But I was lucky to find a job already" God is good! and is in the process of moving back to Ga from DC area.. Even though living comfortable is ideal.. I have had some life challenges so if you are after material gains I'm not for you.. I have great vision regarding where a relationship can go; however, I do have a great deal of self-respect, integrity, honor and morals, and a great deal of respect for others, and know better than to engage in behaviors that are destructive to a relationship. Some may call that old-fashioned, however; that's okay with me, as I believe that that chivalry is not dead!

As I expressed previously, I wish to find a lady whose values are similar to my own; and I am going to remain very open relative to whom I meet at this stage of my life.. I am a nonsmoker (of any kind); drug and disease free; neat, clean and organized; and am only interested in someone who is also a nonsmoker; who is both drug and disease free; who is not a drama queen; who is not into mind games; or who is messy, unkempt or disorganized, So having a great personality being sexy, fit
loving and very understanding career driven is key!
B.. A.. S.. I.. C.. S... L.. O.. V.. E..

B- be who you are
A- appreciate your partner
I- invest time in building a foundation, Rome was not built in 1 day.
C- communicate, compromise & cherish each other
S- share your goals with each other and strive to live life with each other build a empire

title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. I Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

title: Mormon Mafiosa
text:
Yes, I know you're in DC somewhere - a single LDS woman, part of that fantastic Mormon Mafia across DC/NOVA. We may have worked together in the past, or have similar professional interests. I'm looking for you. Because I'm looking to find a great person with whom to build a family. 

So here's the deal...

After my time working on the taxpayer dime, I presently own two very successful businesses. I'm highly educated, I speak 3 foreign languages, and I'm exceedingly family oriented - if you want an attractive, successful, and dedicated man who places family and fatherhood at the center of his priorities, keep reading.

Wondering what the catch is yet?

I grew up in a largely LDS community, but I'm not Mormon myself. That said, I've got well over a dozen active LDS friends from school and my work in DC, and at several points have considered joining the Church. So, you've got sincerity of respect for the church and interest in joining, that for several reasons just hasn't been acted upon yet. I would, however, strongly consider joining.

I'm going to share something else driving my sincerity and interests: I've had several disturbing revelations during my work overseas the last decade, which have left me with zero doubt that the Mormon Church is a citadel in God's plan, and that I need to look into becoming part of it.

No joke.

The revelations weren't some sort of waking vision or mystical dream, but they were very real, only more like being guided into a series of successively right places at the right times to be shown some very important things, in some incredibly unlikely ways. But they are very real and they certainly weren't pursued - they're the kinds of things where five minutes earlier or later, one life choice different, or one gut instinct not being listened to at any dozen places along my life, and I'd still be blind to it all.

All told, what you have with me is a dedicated, highly successful, globally experienced, family-oriented man who grew up surrounded by LDS types, who has exceptionally sincere and serious reasons for looking at joining your Church. It has its rough spots, but overall...I have my reasons to be interested in joining. 

The only thing is, every time I've talked to one of your missionaries, the gut keeps telling me it's not right...yet. Same sense of danger I've had in bad places telling me to change course immediately, but very clearly with undertones telling me it's just not the right time yet, not the right way. Like I'm supposed to wait for someone else to guide me into the Church. It happens every time.

So...maybe I'm supposed to be looking for you. Or someone you know. That path feels very clear, and very right. A woman who may become my wife at some point introducing me to the Church. I've survived and thrived by trusting my instincts, so I'm not going to question it.

One thing I want to make clear, is that I'm not drafting this post for lack of dating options - dating is easy and comfortable for me. What is lacking is a woman grounded with the right values and life expectations, combined with my separate interest in your Church. 

Now, what would make you the right one for me?

You're professional, educated, and within a few years either way of 30. You've faithfully attended church and have been involved with it beyond Sundays, because it matters to you personally. You value family quite highly, you value home, you want a whole passel of kids, and you're kind of looking around wondering why in the heck you're not married yet.

You may suspect you're still single because you're a little too successful, but won't be lowering yourself to the point of wearing a skirt that's just a little too short to your singles ward. You have dignity, grace, and keep yourself put together well. Something along the lines of Molly Mormon meets Ann Taylor.

Importantly, here's what you want in a husband: you want him to be a man you would respect even if just friends - an unapologetic leader, provider, protector, and standard-bearer for your values and that which matters. You want a man who is both socially sophisticated and refined, yet capable of efficiently handling the dirtiest of business a broken car, broken animal, or broken person could bring. You want a man who has no time for the childishness of video games, pornography, sports obsessions, or 'hanging out', who focuses instead on improving himself, his education, his relationships, and his financial base, while pursuing healthy hobbies. You know, hobbies like improving his numchuck skills. Or his bowhunting skills. You want someone whom you can trust, rely upon, and have complete faith in - someone who excites you, mystifies you, makes you feel secure, makes you feel content, and makes you laugh. Someone who brings happiness, life, love, and direction with his world. You want a man of industry, resourcefulness, and perseverance. A man who approaches building family, community, and church involvement as mission - a mission that is at once joyous, consecrated, and not to be messed with.

So there you go. If you want family with a man of many layers, who will make you proud to have brought him into your church for the remainder of your life and possibly beyond, send an email. Get on it - tell me about you, what about my post here resonates, and send a photo or two. Hit me with yer best shot, Molly.



If this doesn't fit you, but you're part of DC's Mormon Mafia and know someone in your life who this would resonate with, please pass it along to her.

EDIT: I've been asked a couple of times why I don't just got to a singles ward - the answer is that I'm not Mormon, and it wouldn't feel right at this point. Part of this post is to find someone for a romantic connection who can introduce me to the Gospel in greater detail over time, on my own time.

title: The Long & Winding Road
text:
Hello! I am a 43 year old educated, professional black male looking for connection. I am in the midst of a divorce. While the process is still being executed, the marriage has been over for at least three years. I have been alone for a long time. I have a vast ocean of love to give, and I am hoping to find someone to spend time with who wants a good man and the affection that he has to offer to assist in generating joy in their life. I am sure that many will say that I am jumping ahead of where I should be. Perhaps that is true, but after spending so much of the last few years knowing that a dream had come to an end, and trying to make it work regardless to no avail, I want to feel what it is like again to share myself with someone who seeks the same type of connection that I am. It is an amicable split, and she knows that I am seeking my future. I do not have kids.

I love music! It fuels me. (Indie Rock, Jazz, folk music, classical, etc.. I love literate, lyrical songs.) I also love movies and good story telling. Yes, I am a bit of a sci-fi nerd, but only in the most sophisticated of ways. I write poetry and prose in my spare time, and I can hold a conversation about most things with most anyone. I can thrive in either the small gathering of friends, or the large party atmosphere. While I like and use technology, I feel very fortunate to have lived long enough in the analog age to appreciate privacy, and having to look what I wanted to know up in an encyclopedia, and having to memorize the numbers of my friends and loved ones. I believe that trust should be offered to everyone, and that if it is lost, only the most heinous of offenses are undeserving of a second chance. Yes, it has cost me at times, but I don't want to see the world any other way. 

Intimacy to me is about talking to and getting to know the woman that I am with. I like to ask questions, (It really is the only way to get to know someone, yes?) and if you invest in sharing an honest answer with me, I will invest in it long enough to hear all of your answer. I have been told by many that I am a wonderful listener. I will tell you whatever you want to know. I don't have anything to hide. I like to hold hands. I love to cuddle. Yes, I like other things too, and am confident in that department, but all things in their right time. 

While I still have a little pudge, I have been working hard to get myself into quality shape, and am doing well with it. I have been told that I have a welcoming smile, and kind eyes. (Your picture for mine, happy to trade.) I do not drink. I have never smoked or used drugs. I have no problem with my partner having the occasional or social drink. I believe in God, and try to live a Christian life, but am not afraid to have fun and accept people for who they are. 

The woman I seek should be 35 - 48, intelligent, willing to communicate who she is, and what she wants, open enough to, and desirous of the receipt of affection from a man who wants nothing more than to offer it to the right woman. You should have a diverse set of interests. You are wise enough to have a healthy amount of cynicism which guides your opinions, as well as your actions before you move, but it hasn't extinguished the sparkle in your eyes when you think about life and the possibilities it holds. You have compassion for those around you which informs who you choose to be. A fearless sense of humor is never a bad thing, and the right commercial will bring you to tears. At your core, you are of a giving nature. Race is not an issue. Culture, and what you want in your life is what I care about. 

If I sound like someone you'd be interested in walking out of the wilderness with, please message me. Please include "Diving into the vast ocean" in your reply. I know that this message is long, but if you didn't have the time or interest to read through all of it while in search of a companion, we probably wouldn't do well together. Good luck to all of us! May we all find the partner we seek!

title: Seeking cuddles, offering cookies...and expecting zero clicks on this
text:
I realize this endeavor has about as much a chance of success as my getting a job at Hooters (these A-minuses I'm rocking are clearly not going to blow anyone's doors off. . .or anything else, for that matter), but, well, worth a shot, right? I mean, it IS Craigslist. . .there are weirdos on here. Like me.

So, what brings me into this den of interweb weirdos? There's no way to say this without sounding douchey, so I'll just say it douchily (that's a word, right?): I need a cuddle. And I'm married.

Yes, I should theoretically get all the cuddling I need at home. But, sadly, circumstances in life seem to be conspiring against that happening, and it's been a long time (years?) since cuddling for the sake of cuddling happened, without all of the attendant pressures and stresses of life intruding on the moment. And I miss that. I miss what it feels like to just get lost in the moment snuggling with someone, feeling them pressed against you, smelling the scent of their hair, just reveling in being close and connected. 

I know what you're thinking--"Hey, dirty old married guy. . .you really just want skeezy sex, but are trying to disguise it as something innocent." That's what I'd be thinking, too, if I were you. I assure you I'm not, but this is CL, and there are weirdos (like me), so why would you believe me?
Hmm. This may be an insurmountable obstacle. Nonetheless, let's press forward. All of you who are no longer reading might be interested. Or not. Since you're no longer reading.

I'm a 36-year-old white professional with brown hair and blue eyes; 5'9"; 150 pounds; generally pretty good smelling. Pretty good at cuddling (by my own reckoning, at least. . .perhaps that doesn't qualify as a ringing third-party endorsement). And I really want to just get lost, if even for an hour, in being close to someone, snuggling with someone, spooning, holding, etc. Life has been incredibly stressful lately, and that sort of contact sounds so relaxing, so amazingly therapeutic. . .sigh.

I know there are services for this sort of thing, and I've inquired, but haven't had any luck finding anyone who's schedule is compatible or who's close enough to make it work. And, it seems weird to pay for that sort of thing (not that I'm opposed to it), as it feels much better when the other person is just as eager to hold and be held. 

So, what am I looking for? Someone who wants the same thing (I should say a lady who wants the same thing. . .sorry, gents; nothing personal). Someone who's ideally available during the day and can host our snuggling. Someone who has a good sense of humor and will look at this the same way I do: a therapeutic modality that will give us both an escape from the stress of life for a little bit, and a chance connect with someone. 

I realize there's exactly 0 people out there who will fit that description, but there's always hope, right? Let me sweeten the pot: I WILL BRING COOKIES! Or whatever baked good tickles your pickle boat (is that a thing?). How can you say no to THAT? 

We could always meet for coffee or something beforehand, too, just to see if we feel like we want to proceed. Snuggling is intimate, and it might be weird to just show up and say, "Hey, nice to meet you, little spoon! Get over here!"

If that sounds remotely interesting, I'd love to hear from you. . .I shan't hold my breath, though, as I'm not very good at that anyway. ;)

(Oh, and for those wondering...I really just do mean cookies. Apparently, as I've learned somewhat awkwardly, that word can mean something else on CL...)

title: Honest Conversations
text:
Where do people (whether married or single) go to have non judgmental conversations with someone? I'm looking for this as well, but I'm way too honest to lie and say I'm single. I'm a young black professional, 35yo male, married and live in Maryland. I try to be as transparent and honest as possible. 

I'm hoping to find someone like minded who would like to share their ideas, goals, and general life experiences with someone outside their immediate circle and would love to connect with someone on different levels. We can talk about anything. I'm at point in my life where I would like to meet someone who can motivate me and I her. 

I have no real preference of race, status, etc... as I'm an open minded guy. Just hoping to find someone with whom I may have a few things in common. I'm consistently trying to learn from people and better myself and my goal is to get to know one woman and maybe go to lunch and chat with down the road. So if you'd like someone to just talk to about whatever, hit me up.

Your past 50 and it shows, that only means there is a story, knowledge and experience behind those lines and a knowledge of what pleasures you the most . No young stud here over 60 just a man who truly enjoys pleasing a women and has no hangup's and knows that a satisfying time comes from communication. Slow is the way to start ,good things come from trust and communication as well as listening . Drop a note who knows mite be the start of a warm old memory .

title: Married, Mature, BBW Woman Only
text:
Are you in a marriage that is like being stuck in quicksand without any fun or adventures? Does your life need a kick start to make you feel like living again? Would you like to have a fun loving, flirty guy with a great personality send you nice emails or texts during the day, or maybe even meet for coffee or lunches on occasion? 

I am 55 years old and am really only attracted to married, older women who are more heavy set in stature. Not a fetish, just a preference. Conversations with a woman, who is intellectual, full of life and has no drama in her life, are traits of a woman that I want to get to know. 

This is for dating and getting to know each other only. Dinners, movies, walking on the beach and spending time outdoors. I like going to sporting events, golfing, hiking, swimming and boating. I'm white, 5'11", 180 lbs and a great personality. 

I am seeking a relationship with a fun, open minded, mature, curvy, woman who is looking for friendship first and great conversation. 50 years of age or older, who is easy on the eyes and a great personality. I am looking for a confident woman who is professional, career driven and genuine. I'm looking for a real woman who is large and in charge of who she is and what she wants. 

Please hit reply if you are interested. Again, I'm only looking for a mature woman who is kind, sincere, and fun to hang out with. Not looking to change marital status, just looking for ONE woman who wants to feel alive again. 

Thanks for reading my ad.

title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

title: The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
text:
The Most Attractive Thing About A Person Is Their Heart & Soul. . ..
Hello, I thought I would give this internet dating a whirl, albeit I am pretty engrossed in work these days. I am a very open-minded, energetic, warm-hearted, and driven individual. I believe when you look past ethnicity and race that the only thing that makes us different from one another is our family and culture. Therefore, based on my respect and tolerance for others, I am open to meeting and/or dating anyone who is kind-hearted, open-minded, and not afraid to have fun and try new things. I love to travel and be around nature (e.g., lakes, water, beaches, and the ocean) as well as enjoying the tranquility and solace from walking on the beach. After meeting a lot of individuals from diverse walks of life, I now know what I am looking for in life. Life is so short! Hence, why not enjoy and spend it with someone worthwhile and who appreciates the good qualities in others. I would prefer someone who does not play games and can stand on their own two feet without constant guidance or acceptance from peer pressure or family. Also, I would like someone who is judiciously venturesome, witty, and can be themselves. Finally, I would like someone who can identify with reality and converse on current practical issues; not the latest whimsical or frivolous banter found in The National Enquirer or Cosmopolitan. If this someone is you or I have intrigued you into possible further correspondence, please feel free to contact me. Please be courteous and send back a current full view picture(s) of yourself, which is only fair as you get to see my full view photos. If you cannot comply by sending recent pictures of yourself, then don't bother to email me back. So that I know you are not SPAM put OCEAN as the subject line when you respond.

title: Seeking SBF who values intelligence and communication
text:
Are you a woman who is turned on first and foremost by a man's intellect, yet who would also like a guy who has an attractive, very masculine, appearance/body, and a definitely non-nerdy personality? Would you like to find an uncommonly intelligent best friend and lover who will really listen and pay attention to you, and who will appreciate your unique qualities?

I am a 6' , lean, well muscled, good looking SWM - a very cerebral intellectual with advanced degrees, who is also intensely physical. My knowledge, interests, skills, and activities are very broad. I want a relationship in which my partner and I find it exciting to exchange thoughts and ideas and do real things together, not one where we sit together mindlessly through the mundane sorts of passive entertainment and other activities that most people consider so important. I enjoy and prefer doing real, constructive things, and would much rather spend time (and show off my knowledge and skills, and admire hers) working with my partner on a creative project, planning a business venture together, or helping her remodel her house, than to do the sort of time and resource wasting activities that most people have been conditioned by our consumeristic society to think of as fun but which are ultimately unfulfilling and counterproductive. 

As for the sort of woman I am seeking: You don't necessarily need to be in the extremely high IQ range, or have advanced degrees, yourself. You do, however, need to have good sense, value knowledge, and have a desire to continue to learn and explore both mentally and physically. You also need to be able to understand and accept that someone with uncommon intelligence is going to think independently, usually not go along with the crowd, and generally be somewhat unconventional. You should desire and enjoy having a man who wants to spend time communicating, verbally, physically, and emotionally with you, and who would much rather spend an evening giving you an incredible massage than goes on for a couple of hours, while telling you his thoughts, ideas, experiences etc., and listening to yours, than to spend those hours watching some bimbos on a screen in some Hollywood nonsense. I'm seeking a woman who is on the slender side (e.g. BMI 22 or less), as in addition to that body type being what I find aesthetically appealing, it reflects a lifestyle, priorities, and attitudes that are most likely to be compatible with mine. Beyond that, I'm pretty much open on physical characteristics, and sometimes features that other men do not find appealing, I find very attractive. Attraction/compatibility based on intellect and actual (rather than preconceived ideas about) physical appearance, makes age largely irrelevant. My ideal woman would be one who has an "ageless" attitude, with the wisdom of a 79 year old and the libido of a 29 year old, whose physical age, like mine, is somewhere in between. Based on experience though, it is most likely that the woman I'm seeking will, like me, be over 40, with both of us eschewing ageism to the extent that we will want to get to know each other and make our judgements based on intellectual and physical compatibility rather than age. 

If you are wondering why I specified a SBF in my headline, it is not because I'm limiting my search for the right woman to only Black women. There are, however, intellectual and emotional characteristics that I find desirable which experience indicates are often found in deep thinking African-American women -- along with them often having some physical features that I find especially appealing (ones likely different from, and more subtle than, those you might assume). Thus, focusing on that group of women seems a good search strategy. Also, the sort of woman who I'm seeking is one who is selective and cautious in her approach to relationships, and will probably be more at ease making contact if she knows that I am definitely open to an inter-racial relationship. 

So, if you are the sort of uncommon woman who is truly turned on by intelligence in a man, and what I have said here makes you think that we might find mutual attraction, I'd like to hear from you.

title: DC Outsider - want professional or student - Beutiful Genuine Real
text:
Hello,

I am from the Midwest, and am Eastern European, so I have double the values, and the morals, then most men you will ever meet. I am educated and speak multiple languages. I am 27, just moved to the DC area for grad school. I am single and looking to meet someone real and genuine. What I have met so far in the bars are very selfish and narcissistic people all about the money.

What I am, currently a grad student who lives on enough loans to hold his own.
What I want is a non superficial person who can look past that I am not rich or in my field yet.
What I have to offer, my genuine heart, conversation, intellect, and handsome good looks. I have a sense of humor and I am quite the charmer. I am sweet genuine, down to earth, straight talker, non cryptic, and not full of crap.

What I am not: all of the typical guys you will meet here, why, because I am not from here, and I still am spiritual enough to realize that there is good in more than just narcissism, and self worship, this coming from someone who used to be atheist, and no longer is, I am grateful for the opportunity to be here.

I am open to different races, different ages, and different body types to an extent. I am attracted to a more curvaceous fuller figure.

I would like to meet a professional woman, or a fellow grad or undergrad student in similar situation. I don't want to meet the artistic unemployed type, sorry I am not into hippies, or neohippies, or hipster type culture, I am in professional program, and I am looking to meet someone similar.

I would also love to meet an open minded person, independent, but not beyonce trample man down attitude person. I would like someone who goes with the flow, to where if the moment was right, and the first kiss was appropriate then let it happen, if we fall asleep cuddling on the couch, we roll with the moment and spend the night together. (that does not mean or imply sex is the goal)

I really want to meet someone genuine and down to earth, and intelligent, and someone I can have conversation with. I don't want pretension, and inhibition. I want someone who is appreciative and giving, and not what can you do for me attitude.

I want us to be able to have a discussion and not hate each other for disagreeing, whether over politics, religion, policy, and beliefs, we should be able to have the most heated discussions, and end the conversation with hugs, kisses, and maybe a shoulder rub, if your feet are cute and maintained, you may get a foot rub:)

I want to enjoy my time here, and I am sure there are women out there who are sick of the cocky arrogant typical DC male, I am not that guy, I am Christian, moraled and principled

I am a gentleman and I open doors, and am not not a pushover lapdog male and I never will be. I look forward to cooking meals together one day, and getting to the point where we buy small gifts for each other just to make each other happy, and me bringing you flowers to make you smile.

I enjoy museums, art culture, history, science, and nature, and walks outdoors or on trails. I also love to read, and enjoy hunting a goodwill or other thrift/consignment stores for a book, or other cool treasures. I am down to do anything fun.

If your attitude is "its capitalism let the middle class die, and take the unemployed worker to the glue factory, because that's our new economy, go **** yourself, and don't email me" I don't believe in that.

Lets have coffee, or a drink during happy hour, I promise you will be intrigued and want to see me again.

Picture in the email would be appreciated, face and torso preferably, as that is what I will send back.

Lastly, I strongly disdain weeks of email communication, I really prefer text after the 1st few introductory emails, google voice, burner, and the block caller feature, are all ways one can protect themselves today. Looking for someone healthy, and STD/STI free. Health is very important. ( I am clean, and can prove it, you should be able too) 

I really look forward to meeting you soon.

title: Are you witty? Kind? Very tall? Sick of DC BS?
text:
So status is kind of a big deal around here, I think we all know that. But I propose something a little bit different. Something where we don't talk about education levels or jobs and just get to know each other on a personality level, even a spiritual level. Everybody rushes around like they're Chicken Little and the sky is falling, wrapped up in a personal bubble that consists of a glowing screen and a pair of iPhone earbuds. Critical thinking, reading, looking before you leap--these are useless to the modern robot. And why? Because the modern robot is overworked, overbooked and stressed out trying to make ends meet because their credit cards are maxed out from buying status symbols and they're busy paying off the education that got them the crummy job they're now pissed that they have but is itself a status symbol. And all the while they're putting "I love my job" in their dating profiles because supposedly no one wants to be with someone who is negative in any way, ever. In the meantime that job they all love so much will cause them to look around them at age 40 and wonder how they never quite managed to meet someone. I'll be honest with you, though. If you yourself fell into the same traps but can at least act normal, we might get along. Hell, we might be able to come up with a plan to help you break free!

If the above makes me sound like a 300-lb. nerd living in his mom's basement with no job, I can assure you none of those details apply to me. Actually, I'm relatively successful, but remember? We're not talking about that. Yet because it's the DC area, I at least have to put that out there for some of you.

"Well then who is this upstart?"

I'm glad you asked. I mean, if you read this far, obviously you did. Now we're not talking jobs, so I'm an author--in my free time. I've self-published two books and have more on the way. It's exciting sometimes and tedious at other times, but always interesting. I write to entertain, to make people feel and to explore life's bigger questions (why are we here, is there a God, etc.). Of course, I'm Catholic, so I believe a lot of things already, but it's still important to analyze and question. I haven't been to church in a while, but I still adhere more or less to the faith.

Aside from writing, I enjoy epic walks, collecting mp3s (I'm working on the world's greatest playlist), trying new foods, drowning my sorrows in coffee and playing old video games and Cards Against Humanity. I also make lots of creative things. Mashups, game levels, custom cards...creativity is fun.

I'm laid back and silly, sometimes lazy, and a fan of sleeping in. Most people I know have never seen me lose my temper, and even when I do, it's a controlled phenomenon. I pride myself on control. I'd rather laugh and be sarcastic than flip out.

And now that you have me in a nutshell, how about you?

We covered a few "do nots" above. What I would like is someone who loves long, intelligent conversations with silliness mixed in. You can start out shy, but if you can help keep the conversation going, it's a plus. If you're generally cheerful, patient and kind, that's good too. Preferably you read, enjoy movies and shows (rare though the good ones may be), love music and would rather relax on the couch than jump out of a plane. Last but not least, taller than six foot would be phenomenal. The taller the better.

I AM NOT 420 friendly. I'm not interested in single moms, only because I want my own kids someday. Could I adopt? Sure. But that would be decided later.

Race is not an issue, I'm not picky about body type, and as for age, roughly 21-34 should work.

If you've read my entire epic ad and you think we have enough in common to warrant a date (or a meetup, or whatever you want to call it), say hi. Let me know what you're thinking. Tell me how your week is going. Let's talk!
